While they are engaged in these kinds of businesses, the couple also cultivates a hectare rice field on which they plant and harvest rice to sell. 

Now, Luisa would like to strengthen the farming business and make it more productive, but she has insufficient funds. This is why she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy insecticides and pesticides to use in farming. This will help nourish the crops and become healthier. 

Someday, with good profits from all their businesses, she will continuously pay the school fees of their children.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and pesticides to use in farming

loans.name: Florinda Juana

texts.es:
La señora Florinda Juana, tiene 60  años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos que lo apoyan económicamente, ya que ella es viuda, se dedica a la elaboración de delantales típicos para diferentes edades, inicio este trabaja gracias al apoyo de un familiar, y hasta el momento lleva 25 años de experiencia, solo así ha mantenido y sustentado a su familia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas típicas de varios diseños y colores, como también hilos y adorno para poder producir mas delantales, y tener mas ganancias, espera en el futuro poder dejar el negocio a uno de sus hijas para que continúe realizando este trabajo, que para ella ha sido de mucho beneficio.
texts.en:
Florinda Juana is 60 years old. She didn't have the chance to go to school. She has 4 children who support her financially, since she is a widow. She makes tradional aprons for different ages. She started this job thanks to support from her family and has 25 years experience. This is the only way she has supported herself and her family. 

She is asking for a loan that she will use to buy traditional fabrics with different designs and colors. She will also buy threads and notions to produce more aprons and have more earnings. She hopes that in the future she can leave her business to one of her daughters she she can continue to do this work that has been so beneficial for her.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabrics for aprons.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lucrecia, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos todos mayores de edad, solo uno  de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga con la ayuda de su esposo y también con la de uno de los créditos hace tres años atrás construyo un pequeño galpón para criar pollos de granja, empezó con poco y hoy mete hasta 200 pollos por temporada, nos cuenta que estos los compra desde pequeños y los mantiene por dos a tres meses, tiempo adecuado para que tengan un buen desarrollo para luego venderlos ya sea por libras o en pie a personas de su localidad o a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pollos y alimentos y medicinas para que estos tengan un  buen desarrollo. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la unión que hay en el grupo.
 
Su sueño es tener buena salud para ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The members of Communal Bank Patito Donald ("Little Donald Duck") meet every fifteen days in the county of Rocafuerte. The area is known for the delicious candies made by the much-renowned locals, and for the warmth of its friendly, hardworking people. 

Lucrecia lives here. She is sixty years old and married and has six children from this relationship. All are grown, and only one of them still lives with her. Her husband makes his living in agriculture.

Our friend, with the help of her husband and a loan from three years ago, constructed a small shed for raising chickens. She started with little and today puts up as many as two hundred chickens each season. She tells us that she buys them when they are small and keeps them for two to three months, time enough for them to have good growth so that she can sell them later at fairs or on foot to people in the area or to merchants who come to the house.

This loan is to buy chickens and feed and medicines so that they can have a good development. She has been with the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it for the sense of cooperation that exists among the group.
 
Her dream is to have good health for herself and her own.

loans.use: to buy chickens as well as feed and medicines for the same.

loans.name: Sandra Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sandra, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 13 y 7 años de edad, los  dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo con su labor realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en sus faenas en el campo, ellos tienen sembríos de arroz, verduras y yuca, nos cuenta que en la actualidad están por recoger la cosecha de arroz la misma que gracias a Dios ha sido muy buena ya que la anterior  se les perdió con el invierno, se les perdió más de una hectárea de sus cultivos pero gracias al crédito anterior pudo volver a sembrar y es esta la cosecha que por suerte está muy buena y les va a permitir recuperara parte de lo perdido.

Este crédito es para pagar mano de obra en la recolección del arroz. Lleva cuatro años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos han salido de situaciones muy difíciles.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of Communal Bank Patito Donald ("Little Donald Duck") meet every fifteen days in the county of Rocafuerte. The area is known for the delicious candies made by the much-renowned locals, and for the warmth of its friendly, hardworking people. 

Sandra lives here. She is thirty-five years old and married, and from this relationship she has three children ages seventeen, thirteen, and seven years old. The two older children are in high school and the youngest in elementary school. Her husband makes his living in agriculture.

Our friend, with the goal of helping her husband in his work, requests this loan for his use in work on the farm. They have fields of rice, vegetables, and yucca. She tells us that they are currently harvesting a crop of rice that thanks to God has been very good, since they lost the previous one due to bad winter weather. They lost more than a hectare of crops, but thanks to their previous loan, they were able to return to planting and since this crop is luckily very good, they will be able to recuperate part of what they lost.

This loan will be used to pay the labor from the rice harvest. Sandra has been with the communal bank for four years and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, they have survived very difficult situations.
 
Her dream is to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Wajida's Group

texts.en:
Wajida is 47 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. She requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her to expand the trading business that she has been doing for five years.

She wants the loan to buy products for daily consumption like bread, milk, eggs, beans, matches, vegetables, fruits and natural drinks, among others. 

She believes in hard work and honesty and is confident that the loan will bring positive changes to her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like bread, milk, and eggs to sell

loans.name: Edgar Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Edgar Eduardo es casado, tiene 40 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de tejidos, pantalones, playeras, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo oficio inició este negocio siendo trabajador para otro negocio, y lleva 10 años de experiencia con este trabajo.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para ampliar su capital de trabajo va a comprar más tela e hilos, espera que en el futuro mejore en ganancias  y mejore su condición de vida, quiere tener un negocio amplio.
texts.en:
Edgar Eduardo is forty years old and married. He didn't have the opportunity to go to school. He has three children who are in school. He makes his living producing textiles such as pants and T-shirts. He counts on the support of his wife who makes her living in the same business. He started this business as a worker for a different company. He has ten years experience with the work.

He decided to request a loan in order to increase his work capital so that he can buy more fabric and thread. He hopes that in the future his earnings and quality of life improve. He wants to have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Zoreen's Group

texts.en:
Since 2009, Zoreen has had a vegetable shop in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 48 years old and lives with her three children.

Zoreen has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to run her vegetable shop. 

With the loan investment, she will buy vegetables of different varieties that will allow her to offer more varieties to her clients and increase her sales and income.

She is a very hard working and honest woman and is confident about her family’s bright future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fresh vegetables to sell

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 26 years old and married with two children. She has been running a general store for over two years. While operating this business, she also looks after her two children and keeps the house clean. It is not easy to take on all these tasks but for Juvy nothing is difficult if it is a matter of family. She works hard to provide for her family.

Now, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to buy items to sell such as cooking oil, vinegar, shampoo, soap and other merchandise. In the future, she aspires to save money to expand her business and for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as cooking oil, vinegar, shampoo, soap, and other merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to build a permanent home for residence.  He has been in the transport business, specifically transporting passengers on a motorcycle.  He faces hardships of high fuel and transportation costs in his business.  His vision is buying land to grow crops and owning at least three motorcycles for his transport business.  Christopher needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for  his transport business.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia, aged 52, is in the business of buying and selling vegetables in her village.  This has been her source of income. She sells bananas, ginger, jackfruit and cabbage. She is very caring and loving of her business because this is her only way to help her family, especially to support their two children.  Now, she feels that their necessities for living has grown, so she must work harder to earn a higher income. But how can she achieve higher income when she suffers insufficiency of capital?   So to make it achievable, Patricia is requesting additional capital in the amount of PHP 16,000 to buy bananas and vegetables such as string beans and potatoes to sell.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a twenty-four-year old man with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  His personal goal is to build a permanent home and educate his child.  He is a photographer and has been in service for three years.  He got the initial capital from family contributions.  His major hardship is inefficiency in the power supply.  He has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming and setting up a modern studio.  Moses needs a loan to set up a studio.

loans.use: set up a photography studio

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 52 years old, married to Leonora and they have two children. The couple has a farming business, which is their only viable source of income. Romeo plants and harvests rice to sell on a hectare of rice field. Twice in a year, he merchandises his crops to traders and gains about PHP 10,000.

Romeo would like to improve his income, so he is now borrowing a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and insecticides) used in farming. This will help nourish his crops so it will produce productive output. 

Romeo has two children attending school. In the future, Romeo hopes to keep growing as a successful farmer and will give to continuously educate his children.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman with 2 children living in Kagadi, Uganda.She owns a salon that she has been running for a period of 8 years. She got her start up capital from her savings as a  school bursar.  Inadequate capital is affecting her business. She would like to educate her children and expand her business to new markets.  Caroline intends to use the loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 58-year-old who is a very friendly, generous and happy person. With 20 years of experience in the business of buying and selling, she has  used these characteristics to gain loyal customers.  Having lots of customers will provide her higher sales. So Corazon keeps on making friends with other people.  

Right now, Corazon is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 18,000 to buy fish paste, beans and monggo. These goods are in demand and she is hoping that her requested loan will be approved in order to purchase her wished for merchandise.

loans.use: buy fish paste, beans and monggo

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is an industrious mother who helped her husband in finding funds for their livelihood. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for over 30 years. She is now 58 years old and has four adult aged children. 

She wants to offer more vegetables to her valued customers but due to financial difficult, she couldn’t. So she is asking for a loan amount of P7,000 to buy cabbage, pechay (type of cabbage) and okra to increase her usual sales. For this, she can now afford to finance their everyday living.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, pechay, and okra

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 32-year-old who is engaged in a buying and selling business that pertains to vegetables. Within a bit over one year of existing in this kind of occupation, she can say she had improved her family’s lifestyle.

To further grow her business, she is asking for a loan amount of P12,000 to buy additional vegetables to sell such as beans, squash, eggplant, and string beans. She hopes that it would attracts more customers that will continuously buy her goods, thus the possibility to lift her family out of poverty will be nearly attained.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell such as beans, squash, eggplant and string beans

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is from the village of Minante 1. She is 45 years old, and is married with three children. Imelda is engaged in her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for seven years. She usually received a net profit of PHP 300 a day. Right now, Imelda is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to buy additional grocery item, such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, and condiments to sell in her sari-sari store. She believes that she can improve the business through her patience and strong determination.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items, such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, and condiments to sell

loans.name: Halim

texts.en:
Halim is now 28 years old, married and has two children attending school.  He runs a small store selling grocery items to the people in his town. His customers are mostly his neighbors who are looking for the affordable prices he offers. 

Halim would like to earn more profits from his business, which is why he is asking for a youth loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy merchandise to sell in his store. He will buy canned good, biscuits, noodles and shampoo to sell. This will help increase sales capacity and will increase his profits too. He hopes to keep offering good service and affordable prices to his customers so that he will earn more income and be able to pay his children's school fees.  He hopes his children will become professionals someday.

loans.use: buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso, aged 46, drives a multi-passenger cab that routes from Gattaran to Aparri.  He has been operating this business for five years and it helps a lot for his family's unstable economic status. To continue the improvement of their lifestyle, Narciso is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 use for repair and maintenance to his cab.

Due to his travelling everyday, his cab requires repair and maintenance. He knows that his cab is also like a human that needs relaxation in order to perform excellent.  So Narciso is hoping that his desired loan will be activated and funded.

loans.use: repair his cab

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Transportation has been Rubelyn's business involvement.  She has been running this business for ten years.  Her main priority is to increase her income.

Rubelyn is 27 years of age and happily married to Marlon. Her spouse is the driver of their own motorcycle transport.  Both of them work hard in order to provide for the needs of their family.  According to Rubelyn, the gained profits go immediately to their daily basic necessities and allowance for her eldest child.  So, Rubelyn struggles with shortage of capital. 

To help her situation, Rubelyn asked for additional capital in the amount of PHP 20,000.  She will be using this loan amount to buy new wheels and to use for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle transport.  This amount would mean a lot to her, most especially in improving her transportation business.  Rubelyn is hoping for the approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: buy wheels and repair her vehicle

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
The only source of income for Evangeline is buying and selling vegetables. She is hard-working and her children adapted this trait. They might not be able to help her in the business but they keep their house organized and clean.  They are dreaming for a better quality of life, so they are being industrious and helpful.

In harmony with their dream, Evangeline is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy cabbages, string beans, eggplants and pechays to sell.  She is very hopeful that through this loan and her hard work, she will achieve a better life with her family.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en: Edelyn, aged 27, works hard to provide for her family. She is engaged in a buying and selling business as a source of income. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan to buy additional vegetables such as potatoes, spices, okra and squash. She is hoping for a higher income this time. Edelyn aspires to save enough money for the education of her three children and hopes to attain it soon through her hard work.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Los Repollitos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los repollitos lo integran tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Juana quien se dedica al comercio de pastelitos, tajadas, repollo, pinolillo y verduras negocio que inicio hace 8 años. El crédito lo invertirá en mercadería para el negocio.
Los otro integrantes son Tania quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 3 años y Roberto quien tiene una fritanga desde hace 6 años.
texts.en: The group "Los Repollitos" is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people. One of them is Juana, whose work is selling pastries, fried plantain slices, cabbage, a cornmeal and cocoa based beverage called "pinolillo" and vegetables in a business that she started 8 years ago.  She will invest the loan in merchandise for the business.  The other members are Tania, who has had a local store since three years ago, and Roberto, who has a had a business that sells classic Nicaraguan dishes since 6 years ago.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like bananas, cabbage, corn, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 33-year-old who loves to care for animals. With this peculiarity, he had made it a source of income. He built a small shelter at the back of his small house where he raises his livestock (goats).

To prosper in his business, Joseph is requesting a loan of 6,000 pesos to buy vitamins and additional goats to raise.  He hopes to save enough money from his business in order improve the poor living conditions of his family, as well as to educate his three children.

loans.use: buy goats and livestock vitamins

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is a hardworking mother of five children. She is enduring the hardship of selling vegetables on a house-to-house basis to earn a living, and she wishes to have a greater income. For that purpose, she is asking a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy bagio beans, cauliflower, cabbage and onions to sell.

Through the loan, Venus hopes to improve her business as well as to acquire improved income in order to live an enhanced livelihood.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 33 years old. He is married and blessed with one child.  He lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Pov has been a civil servant in Phnom Penh city since 2006, earning USD 5 per day. His wife is a food seller who earns about USD 7 per day. Each month, he has to spend USD 35 on food, USD 10 on utility expenses, and around USD 45 for other expenses. 

In order to improve his wife's business, Pov is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to make a new big store for getting more clients. He hopes this loan will help their family earn more profit to support their living standard. In the future, he wishes to expand the food store, sell soft drinks, noodles and soups.  Moreover, he hopes he can support his child get a high education.

loans.use: build a store

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna is 38 years old. She is married and resides with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been a worker in a factory in Takeo province since 2010, earning USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 10 per day. Each month, she has to spend on food USD 15, utility expense USD 5, and other expenses around USD 30. 

In order to improve her husband's business, Vanna is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase construction supplies. She hopes this loan will help their family earn more profit to support their living standard. In the future, she hopes she can get a new big house, expand her husband's business to become better, and support her children to get a high education.

loans.use: buy construction supplies

loans.name: Kimsa

texts.en:
Kimsa is 39 years old. She is married and resides with her 5 children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. Kimsa makes and sells rice wine at home, earning an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a security guard at a farm since 2008, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. One of her children is a mechanic, earning an income of about USD 2 per day. Each month, she has to spend on food about USD 20, on utility expense about USD 5, school fees about USD 30 and other expenses around USD 25. 

In order to help her family get more profit, Kimsa is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase pigs to resell. In the future, she hopes she will increase her pig raising and support her children to get a high education.

loans.use: buy pigs

loans.name: Nueva Generacion Group

texts.es:
Reciban ustedes un gran saludo desde el Perú!!!, hoy les presento al Grupo NUEVA GENERACION, conformado por 9 socios, es un grupo emprendedor y muy unido, están participando en su segundo ciclo, y por eso es que saben que la puntualidad y la responsabilidad es lo primordial. Una de las socias es Carmen ella tiene 60 años y es madre soltera de 02 hijos, solo vive con el segundo hijo que aun sigue estudios superiores técnicos gracias al apoyo de los ingresos que genera su restaurante, que ya van a ser casi 20 años sacando adelante este negocio, y sus fieles comensales van incrementándose gracias a la sazón especial que pone en cada una de sus preparaciones.Carmen va utilizar este préstamo en la compra de de insumos como son arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc, por mayor para que los costos de sus comidas sean menores generando mayores ingresos para su hogar. El sueño de Carmen es, primero sacar profesionales a sus hijos (que ya lo está logrando), también poder ampliar el local con el que cuenta para poder brindar comodidad a sus comensales.
Carmen esta con una casaca negra y polo blanco. *en esta fotografía no se encuentra presente Jenny Bell, por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Peru sends a big hello to all of you! Today we present the group Nueva Generacion [New Generation], made up of 9 members. This group is enterprising and very united. They are in their second cycle so they know that punctuality and responsibility are of the utmost importance. 

One of the members, Carmen, is 60 years old and a single mother of two. She only lives with her younger son who continues his higher education at a technical school thanks to the income that her restaurant provides. It's been almost 20 years since she started this business and her loyal customers continue to increase thanks to the special seasoning that she puts in all of her meals. 

Carmen will use this loan to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles, oil, etc. in bulk so that her meals cost less to make which earns her greater profits for her household. Her dream, which is already coming true, is first for her sons to become professionals, and also to be able to increase the space where she serves food to give her customers greater comfort.

Carmen is wearing a black jacket and white t-shirt in this photo. Jenny Bell does not appear in the picture for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, etc in bulk.

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.es:
Don Armando tiene la edad de 45 años, desde joven ah trabajado para salir adelante, estudio la carrera administración de empresa, pero fue uno más de lo que no encontró trabajo, lo que, tuvo que buscar alternativa para subsistir, junto a su pareja con poco dinero comenzaron a vender quesillos y gaseosas, el cual le fue bien, y con ganancias comenzaron a vender en mas cantidad cada día. De este matrimonio nació mi hijo el cual tiene 8 años y cursa la primaria.
Hoy en día, soy padre soltero, ya que estamos separados. Mi negocio cambio por venta ambulante de quesillos  a una pequeña pulpería que quiero aumentar en productos para lograr el crecimiento y tener mejores resultados de ganancias. Esto será posible a travez del financiamiento otorgado en Afodenic, en donde comprara: gaseosas, golosinas, carne, pollo, dos mesas y sillas para comenzar a vender fritanga por las noches, y poder tener otra entrada que ayude a dar lo mejor a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Armando, 45, has worked since he was young in order to get ahead. He studied business management but among those who couldn't find a job. He had to look for an alternative to get by. Together with his wife and a little bit of money they started selling cheese and sodas which went well. With their profits they started to sell in greater quantities every day. From this marriage they had a son who is 8 and in elementary school.

"Today I am a single father because we are separated. My business changed from selling cheese door to door into a small grocery store where I want to increase the products to grow and have more profits." This will be possible through the loan from Afrodenic which will buy sodas, snacks, meat, chicken, two tables and chairs to start selling home cooked meals at night and have another way to help give his young son the very best.

loans.use: to buy sodas, snacks, meat and chicken to offer more on sale.

loans.name: Eddys Manuel

texts.es: Eddys de 34 años de edad es casado, tiene 4 hijos, trabaja como conductor de taxis obteniendo ingresos que le permiten el sosten familiar, ademas tiene un negocio adicional donde encuaderna documentos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa en este pequeño negocio, la que ademas se dedica al cuido de sus hijos.  Solicita financiamiento para poder construir una tapia que le permita dar seguridad a su familia.  Sueña con poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones y que en el futuro sus hijos estudien y sean personas de bien.
texts.en: Eddys, 34, is married and has four children. He works as a taxi driver earning money that lets him take care of his family. He also has another business binding documents. His wife helps with that small business as well as caring for their children. He asks for a loan to be able to build a wall that will give his family greater security. He dreams of being able to give his family better conditions and that in the future his children will be able to study and be upstanding people.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon is a 30-year-old hard-working man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He trades in produce and has been in this business for two years. Inadequate capital to meet the high demand is the factor most affecting his business. He would like to educate his seven children and buy a car to ease transport problems to different suppliers. Benon wants a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Juana Vilma

texts.es: Juana de 60 años de edad es soltera, tiene 3 hijos, el menor de 20  y los mayores ya casados y con su propia familia.  Solicita refinanciamiento de credito con el proposito de invertir en su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda, espera poder comprar 2 pacas de ropa y ademas comprar telas que le encargan algunos de sus clientes que dan a confecdionar la ropa.  Cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos.  Doña Juana durante ha trabajado se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en: 60-year-old Juana is single and has 3 children. The youngest is 20, and the older ones are already married with their own families. She is requesting a loan refinancing for the purpose of investing in her business of secondhand clothing sales. She hopes to be able to purchase 2 bales of clothing, and also to buy fabric ordered by some of her clients who make the clothing. She counts on the support of her children. Juana has been characterized in her work as being a very responsible and hardworking person.

loans.use: to sell clothing.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos es casado, tiene un hijo de 3 meses de edad, su esposa trabaja y ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Carlos trabaja para la alcaldia de morrito.  Solicita su primer credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto que le permita dar comodidad a su familia en especial a su bebecito.  Espera poder seguri contando con el apoyo de esta financiera para continuar mejorando su casa y las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Carlos is married and has a 3-month-old son. His wife works and helps out with the household expenses; Carlos works for the Morrito mayor’s office. He is requesting his first loan with the goal of building a bedroom, which will allow him to make his family more comfortable - especially his little baby. He hopes to be able to continue counting on the support of this loan partner so he can keep improving his home and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to construct a bedroom.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en: Gertrude is a 53-year-old married woman with two children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop where she sells mostly soft drinks. She got start-up capital after selling off her crops since she is also a farmer. Inadequate capital and price fluctuations are factors affecting her business. She would like to educate her children and hire employees to help her expand her business. Gertrude wants a loan to buy beers, sodas and bottled water to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas and bottled water to sell.

loans.name: Marta Nelly

texts.es:
Marta se encuentra casada y tiene 1 hijo de 7 años de edad, y debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para poder sostener todos los gastos de su hogar, Marta decidió comenzar con su propio negocio para contribuir económicamente y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar. Fue así como comenzó su venta de productos de uso personal a través de catálogo y desde entonces la calidad de vida de su hogar ha mejorado considerablemente. Actualmente, a pesar de que tienes grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes, aún tiene dificultades económicas para poder surtir su negocio y responder a estos pedidos, es por esto que Marta busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.


De esta manera superará la dificultad de capital que tiene y su negocio logrará salir adelante permitiéndole tener cada vez mejores venta, además de mejores ingresos para su hogar y por ende mejor calidad de vida para su esposo y su hijo.
texts.en:
Marta is married and has a son who's seven years old. Due to the fact that her husband's earnings were not sufficient to be able to support all the household expenses, Marta decided to begin her own business in order to contribute financially and thus be able to have a better quality of life at home. Like this she began selling personal items by catalog and since then, her household's quality of life has improved considerably. Currently, despite her having large orders from her customers, she still has financial difficulties in being able to stock her business and respond to these orders. Because of this Marta is looking for a loan in order to buy personal items and respond to her customers' orders.

In this way she will overcome the difficultly she has with capital and her business will manage to move forward, allowing her to have better sales each time in addition to better earnings for her household, and consequently, a better quality of life for her husband and son.

loans.use: to buy personal items and respond to her customers' large orders.

loans.name: Denys

texts.en:
Denys is 41 years-old and is married with five children. Denys sells various goods such as: tomatoes, onions, small fish,cakes, etc. He has three years of experience in this work and he currently employs one person to help him. The hours of his work are from 7 a.m to 9 p.m every day each week. 

Denys has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as: tomatoes, onions, small fish, cakes, etc to resell.  With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future, reinvest in his business and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as: tomatoes, onions, small fish, cakes, etc to resell.

loans.name: John Mary

texts.en: John Mary is a 35-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is in the phone accessories business, which he has run for a period of eight years. He was an employee in one of the telecommunication companies, and after accumulating enough savings he set up the business. He would like to educate his children and expand his business to new markets. John Mary intends to use the loan to buy phones and airtime to sell.

loans.use: to buy phones and airtime to sell.

loans.name: Maira Diana

texts.es: Maira tiene una tienda de venta de víveres, también mantiene la venta de ropa a crédito que fue con lo que inicio su vida comercial, siempre le ha gustado trabajar antes lo hacía por ser independiente y cubrir sus gastos ahora para ayudar a su esposo. La tienda la abre de lunes a viernes  y los fines de semana solo en la mañana ya que la tarde la aprovechan para vender su ropa. Tiene 3 hijos y desde muy pequeños le está enseñando el valor del dinero y como se consigue haciéndolos conocer su importancia es por esto que ellos atienden los fines de semana. Los recorridos de venta de su ropa lo realizan junto a una hija ya que ella conoce a sus clientes y podría realizar la cobranza en el caso de requerirlo. El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, enlatados, embutidos y ropa, así aumentara su mercadería cubriendo las necesidades de sus cliente y mejorar sus ventas. El sueño que tiene a futuro es empezar la construcción de su casa ya que es de caña y está en mal estado.
texts.en: Maira started her life as a retailer by selling clothes on credit, and activity she continues carrying out on top of running a grocery store. She has always enjoyed working, at first to be economically independent and to pay for her own expense, and now to help her husband. Her shop is open Mondays to Fridays; during the week-ends she opens it only in the morning, as she uses the afternoons to sell her clothes. She has 3 children, and she has been bringing them to the shop every week-end since they were very young, in order to teach them the value of money and how to make a living. When travelling to sell her clothes Maira brings along one of her daughters, who already knows the customers and could collect the due amounts if the case may be. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, oil, canned food and clothes, in order to stock up her inventory to meet her customers’ needs and to improve her sales. The house she lives in is made of reed and it is in a bad shape, and Maira’s dream is to succeeded in building her own house in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, canned food and clothes.

loans.name: Yolanda Monica

texts.es: Yolanda vive en Isla Trinitaria donde alquila un local para su negocio el cual es la venta de frutas. Esta actividad es familiar y se dedica a ella desde hace varios años trabajando sola porque su esposo recorre la ciudad con la venta. El negocio lo empezó junto a su esposo con el préstamo a un familiar dedicándole todo su esfuerzo y persistencia para salir adelante. En su local ofrece toda clase de frutas como naranjas, sandias, papayas, plátano o si desean ensaladas de frutas y jugos naturales pasa todo el día ya que no tiene niños. Con el préstamo va a comprar frutas, colas, arroz, enlatados, azúcar, café etc., quiere surtir aprovechando el espacio para empezar una tienda. Su mayor sueño es poder comprar una camioneta así la compra sería más fácil y ofrecería productos más frescos.
texts.en: Yolanda lives in Isla Trinitaria: here she pays rent for a shop where she sells fruits. This is a family activity and she has been engaged in it for various years, working alone because her husband travels around town selling their products. She has started this activity with her husband thanks to a loan received from a family member, and she engages in her job with great energy and determination in order to progress in life. She sells every kind of fruit in her shop, such as oranges, watermelons, papayas and bananas; she also prepares fruit salads and natural juices on demand. She works there all day long, as she has no children. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fruits, colas, rice, canned food, sugar, coffee and other products as she wants to stock up her inventory in order to open a store by taking advantage of some free space in her locale. Her biggest dream is to succeed in buying a van so that buying items will be easier for her and she will be able to offer fresher products.

loans.use: To buy fruits, colas, rice, canned food, sugar, coffee and other products.

loans.name: Sonia Merlene

texts.es: Sonia vive en una casa de su propiedad cerca de Libertad, su domicilio es de construcción mixta y cuenta solo con los servicio de agua y luz. Ella se dedica a la venta de huevitos chilenos en las ferias o recorriendo la ciudad, decidió empezar el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos ya que su trabajo no le alcanzaba, al principio fue muy difícil ya que era ama de casa y no sabía muy manejarse en la actividad, con el paso del tiempo fue ganando experiencia y saliendo adelante. Ella lleva varios años con el negocio, regularmente vende por la mañana y le ayudan sus hijos. Los huevitos chilenos a pesar del nombre es un dulce típicamente ecuatoriano, su preparación es un poco larga pero al final es muy apetecible. Para su preparación utiliza levadura, leche, azúcar, sal, mantequilla y harina una vez mezclados se fríen en aceite caliente y se sirven bañados de chocolate, confetis, grageas de sabores. El dulce es muy apetecido por los niños y adultos. El crédito lo empleara en comprar los ingredientes y algunas ollas para su venta y elaboración. A futuro desea poder terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Sonia lives in a house on her property near Libertad. Her home is a mixed construction and the only utilities it has are water and light. She earns her living selling "Huevitos Chilenos" ( Chilean eggs) at fairs or mobilely around the city. She decided to start the business to help her husband with the household expenses since his job alone did not meet them. At first it was very difficult since she was the homemaker and did not know how to get by with this sort of work. However, with time she started to gain experience and get ahead. She has been working in this business for a number of years and regularly goes out selling with the help of her children. 

"Chilean Eggs," despite their name, are an Ecuadorian sweet. Their preparation time is quite long but they are delicious when they are cooked. For their preparation you use yeast, milk, sugar, salt, butter and flour. Once this is mixed together you fry them in hot oil and serve them covered with chocolate, sprinkles or flavoured icing. This sweet is very tempting for both children and adults.

She will use the loan to buy the ingredients and some pots for cooking and sales. In the future she hopes to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy yeast, milk, sugar, salt, butter and flour.

loans.name: Gloria Katty

texts.es: Gloria comenzó cuando tenía 20 años tenía una pequeña tienda y luego por la gran acogida que tuvo en el negocio lo fue agrandando mas. Han pasado 13 años desde que inicio el negocio con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación por lo que hoy siente la satisfacción de ver su crecimiento. Atiende de lunes a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche los productos de venta son víveres, lácteos, carne, enlatados productos de primera necesidad. Su esposo también es microempresario ya que tiene una pequeña ferretería junto a su negocio. Tener ambos negocios le ayuda con sus gastos ya que tiene cinco hijos de los cuales 3 estudian en la escuela fiscal, espera con el crédito poder comprar mas mercadería para ampliar ambos negocios y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria started her business when she was 20 years old.  She had a small store that, due to its huge acceptance, she expanded more and more.  It has been 13 years since she opened through a lot of effort and dedication, and now she has the satisfaction of having seen it grow.  Monday through Sunday, from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. she sells essential groceries, dairy products, meat and canned goods.  

Her husband is a small business owner and has a small hardware store next to her business.  Having both businesses helps cover expenses for their family of five children, three of whom study at the fiscal school.  

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to buy more merchandise to expand both businesses and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy groceries, dairy products, meat and canned goods.

loans.name: Marcos Angel

texts.es: Marcos es chofer profesional se dedico por muchos años a dar servicio de fletes para clientes, su carro se averió y la reparación tiene un costo muy alto por lo que decidió alquilar un vehículo para trabajar siendo taxista en una cooperativa legal. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde realizando recorridos por toda la ciudad. El mayor problema de Marcos es la competencia de  taxis piratas ya que los costos por carreras son menores al no estar legalizados en una cooperativa. El trabajo que realiza es cansado ya que pasa manejando todo el día por lo que el sol no ayuda, también da gracias a Dios porque no a tenido mayores problemas por la delincuencia. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo ya que necesita trabajar en los fletes los fines de semana. El sueño que tiene es comprar un taxi propio y así no pagaría alquiler.
texts.en:
Marcos is a professional driver who has been offfering transportation service to customers for many years.  His vehicle broken down and the cost of repair is very high so he decided to rent a vehicle to work as a taxi driver in a legal co-op.  He works Monday through Friday from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., covering routes throughout the entire city.  

Marcos' greatest problem is the competition from pirate taxis who offer lower rates since they are not legally associated to the co-op.  The work he does is tiresome since he is driving all day long and the hot sun does not help.  But he is thankful that he has not had major problems with delinquency.

The loan he is requesting is to buy spare auto parts because he needs to work in other transportation areas on the weekends.  His goal is to buy his own taxi and not have to rent one,.

loans.use: To buy spare auto parts.

loans.name: Topista

texts.en:
Topista is a married woman who has three children and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. For four years, she has been operating a bar as a business: with the proceeds, she has been able to pay her children's school fees. 

Topista received the initial capital from her husband and she is so proud of her achievements. Inadequate capital is the factor which most affects her business. She would like to support her children's education and expand her business. Topista wants a loan to buy beer and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Don esteban sigue con su negocio, una pulpería que ha crecido en todo estos años, al ofertar más productos y la captación de clientes, con dinero propio y préstamo en Afodenic, el cual ha mejorado las condiciones de vida para su familia, al tener un negocio solido y una vivienda segura. Vive junto a su esposa ambos esforzándose para el bien comun, de sus tres hijos, solo dos estudian y el mayor trabaja. Esteban sigue haciendo sus trabajos de mecánica cuando lo buscan.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo, construirá dos cuarto en la parte del fondo del patio, con el fin de que sus hijos tengan privacidad. Materiales a comprar: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, piedrín, tablas de madera, estribos y otros para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Esteban keeps on running his grocery store. His activity has grown a lot in the past few years, as he has been able to offering more products and to gain more customers thanks to his own money and to a loan received from Afodenic, and in this way he has succeeded in improving his family’s standard of living, in owing a stable activity and in living in a safe house. He and his wife work hard for the wellbeing of their family, and they live together with their three children, two of whom are studying while the eldest has a job. Esteban also continues working as a mechanic whenever his services are required.

The new loan he is currently requesting will be used to build two rooms at the end of the courtyard, in order to give some privacy to his children. He will buy stone, sand, cement, iron, gravel, wooden planks, support and other materials to start the works.

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement, iron, gravel, wooden planks, support and other materials to build two rooms.

loans.name: Luz Balvina

texts.es: Luz vive en Milagros ciudad conocida por sus frutales, tiene 50 años de edad es separada y tiene 4 hijos. Ella empezó hace tres años a vender víveres por la necesidad de encontrar una manera de tener ingresos, con esfuerzo y dedicación aumento paulatinamente, hoy en día en su local ofrece artículos de bazar, productos farmacéuticos y víveres en general. Abre su negocio de lunes a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche esto es porque  sus hijos son mayores de edad y viven independiente. En su negocio pasa la mayor parte del tiempo ya que le gusta sentirse útil dejando de depender de otros, además la mantiene activo lo que es provechoso a su edad. El préstamo que está solicitando lo empleara en la compra de una vitrina, perchas y mercadería para mejorar la presentación de su local.
texts.en:
Luz lives in Milagros, a city known for its fruit groves.  She is 50 years old, divorced and has four children.  Three years ago she began selling groceries in an effort to earn an income; and, through her effort and dedication she has been able to gradually increase business.  Nowadays she sells bazaar items, pharmaceutical products and groceries in general.  She opens Monday through Sunday, from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., since her children are adults and live independently.

She spends most of her time in her store since she feels productive and does not have to depend on anyone else.  It also keeps her active, which is good at her age.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a display case, hangers and merchandise to improve the store's image.

loans.use: To buy a display case, hangers and merchandise.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is 45 years old, is married and lives with her five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1990, earning income of approximately USD 2 per day. Three of her children are singers and workers in a factory, earning profit of approximately USD 10 per day. Each month, Thy has to spend about USD 50 on food, USD 5 on utility expenses and USD 35 on other expenses. 

Thy is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase wood and cement to build a kitchen. This loan will help her to have a new kitchen providing good conditions for when they are cooking. In the future, she hopes she can build a toilet for everyday use.

loans.use: to purchase wood and cement to build a kitchen

loans.name: Las Comerciantes  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Comerciante está formado por 9 socias quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, conocida oficialmente como la Santa Ana de los Ríos, situada al sur de la República del Ecuador y es la capital de la provincia del Azuay. Su gente es amable y de un corazón muy cálido, mantiene su gastronomía típica que es muy variada, sus costumbres y tradiciones  enamora a sus visitantes.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Norma,  tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 21, 8 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segundo hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la construcción laborando como albañil, la casa en la que viven es  propiedad de su padre.
 
Doña Norma es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado y juguetes, esta actividad la realiza hace 16 años, cuenta con un gran surtido de mercadería, labora solo días de ferias y los demás días se dedica al cuidado de su familia.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la  compra de ropa, calzado y juguetes.

Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
The communal bank of Las Comerciantes is comprised of nine women who live in different areas of the city of Cuenca, known officially as Santa Ana de los Ríos, in the southern part of the Republic of Ecuador and the capital of the province of Azuay.  Its people are kind and warm-hearted, and maintain the typical gastronomy which is considerably varied.  Their customs and traditions win over the hearts of its visitors.

One of the members of this group is Norma, who is 39 years old, married and has three children, ages 21, 8 and 2.  Her eldest son works and helps out economically.  Her middle son goes to the local school.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  The house they live in belongs to her father.

Norma is a merchant and sells clothing, shoes and toys.  She has been in business for 16 years and has a wide range of merchandise.  She only works on holidays and spends the rest of her time dedicated to the family.

The member has been in the communal bank for two years and this new loan will be used to buy clothing, shoes and toys.

Her goal is to pay off her debts.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and toys.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 50-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been rearing cattle for the past 10 years. He started by farming crops and after selling his proceeds he diversified into rearing cattle. Price fluctuations for milk and unpredictable seasonal weather affect his business. 

William would like to support his children's education and expand his business to new markets. He wants a loan to buy cattle to rear.

loans.use: to buy cattle to rear.

loans.name: Vegaspamba  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Vegaspamba está formado por 18 mujeres quienes viven por la comunidad de Vegaspamba que pertenece a la parroquia de Jada en Cuenca, comunidad que mantienen las tradiciones y costumbre de sus fiestas, como es baile de disfrazados, banda de músicos, castillos, vacas locas, la quema de fuegos pirotécnicos, etc., la principal ocupación de los habitantes es la agricultura y la avicultura, cultivan maíz, fréjol, trigo y arveja, también laboran en la elaboración de sogas. Son personas amables y gentiles, su mayor orgullo es que aun mantienen viva las tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa Balvina, tiene 60 años de edad, está separada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes, ella cuida de un nieto desde que era muy pequeño y hoy tiene 13 años y está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
  
Doña Rosa Balvina trabaja en el campo, se dedica a la agricultura  y lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su casa, tambien cría y vende cerdos, cuyes y gallinas. Para no perder las tradiciones de sus padres aprendió desde muy joven la elaboración de sogas, trabajo que aun sigue vivo en su comunidad.
 
Es socia fundadora del banco comunal y  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales y nylon para la elaboración de las sogas.

Su mayor sueño es que su nieto llegue a ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
The communal bank Vegaspamba is comprised of 18 women who live in the community of Vegaspamba, which belongs to the Jada Parish in Cuenca.  This community maintains the traditions and customs of its festivities, such as a masquerade dance, music band, fireworks, crazy cows, etc.  The activities the majority of the inhabitants is involved in are agriculture and poultry farming.  They grow corn, beans, wheat, peas and also make rope.  They are a kind, gentle people whose major source of pride is the fact that they keep the traditions of their villages alive.

One of the members of this group is Rosa Balvina, 60, who is divorced and has six children who are all adults, married and live independently.  She takes care of a grandson who is now 13 and studying at the city school.  The house she lives in belongs to her.

Rosa Balvina works as a farmer and what she harvests is for home consumption.  She also raises and sells pigs, guinea pigs and chickens.  In order not to lose the tradition she learned from her parents of making rope, she still does this in her community.

She is a founding member of the communal bank, and will use this new loan to buy animal feed and nylon to make rope.

Her greatest dream is for her grandson to become a good professional.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and nylon.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel lives in Fort Portal, Uganda and is a 33-year-old married man with one child. His personal goal is to support his child's education. He has been a motorcycle driver and also a part-time teacher for six years now. After realizing that the meager salary of a primary school teacher could not support his family, Emmanuel bought a motorcycle, and he is proud of the benefits that he's reaping. 

Emmanuel faces the challenge of mechanical breakdowns, and his desire is to own at least three motorcycles. He needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 26-year-old married man who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent home. Samuel has been a trader for two years, and his main hardships are price fluctuation and inflation. He has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming and of expanding his business into new markets. Samuel needs a loan to buy saucepans, glasses and cups to sell.

loans.use: to buy saucepans, glasses and cups to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 41-year-old married man with 12 children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children to university level. Francis has been running a butcher's shop for 20 years and earned his initial capital by selling bananas.

His main hardship is inadequate capital to buy enough cows while he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming. Francis needs a loan to buy cows to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 56-year-old married man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and buy a car. He has been a farmer for 20 years, and his main hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather. 

Francis has a vision of buying land to grow crops, moving his business to a more permanent location and expanding his business to new markets. He needs a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Aberi

texts.en:
Aberi is a 60-year-old man with seven children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to build a permanent home and educate his children. He has been working in the food business for the past 40 years and his main hardships are price fluctuations and inflation.

Aberi has a vision of moving his business to a more permanent location. He needs a loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a hard-working man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children up to university level. He has been workng in the food business for eight years, and his main hardships are price fluctuations and inflation.

Julius has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming. He needs a loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a 52-year-old married man with four children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been farming for 30 years. His hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. 

Augustine's personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to buy land for growing crops. He wants the loan to buy fertilizers for his plantations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his plantations.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 30-year-old married man with two children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He  has been working as a teacher for the past six years. His hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. 

William's personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to buy land for growing crops. He needs the loan to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 42-year-old married man with six children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling the local brew for 10 years. John started by selling one jerrycan per month and now sells 10 jerrycans per month. His hardship is customers who do not pay on time. 

John's personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is is to expand his business into new markets. He wants the loan to buy the local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy the local brew to sell.

loans.name: Kyempara Women Group

texts.en:
Faith is a 48-year-old married woman with eight children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for four years. Faith started with 400,000 Ugandan shillings and now has 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings as working capital. Her hardships are inadequate capital for purchasing stock, price fluctuations and inflation.

Faith's personal goals are to build a permanent home and to educate her children. Her business goals are to buy land for growing crops and to diversify her business. Faith wants the loan to buy sugar and soap to sell.

She is a member of the above-mentioned group where each member guarantees the others when accessing a loan. That is why other members are in the photo even when they are not taking out this loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa, aged 41, is married and the mother of one son. Her husband is a school teacher who earns a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past three years, Safa has operated a grocery store selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project but not earning enough to cover the costs.

Safa is requesting a USD 1,500 loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing the necessary stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar and  milk, and to make store improvements such as installing additional shelves. This will increase sales and increase Safa's income, which will enable her to live with her family in better conditions.

Safa is photographed in her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell and to make store improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en: Specioza is a married woman with four children and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. She has operated a retail shop business for the past 9 years. Inadequate capital to supply the vast market is a major challenge. Specioza would like to educate her children and expand her business to new markets. She wants a loan to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been operating a soft drinks business for a period of five years. Inadequate capital and price fluctuations are factors affecting his business. Robert would like to educate his children and hire employees to help expand his business. He wants a loan to buy sodas and bottled water to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas and bottled water to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Narcisa

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por el sector del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad que tiene un espacio físico pródigo de belleza y valores culturales, los mismos que le dieron el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en Diciembre de 1999, su gente es amable, gentil, mantienen aun la gastronomía típica, la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Rosa tiene 40 añosa, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  de 23, 17, 16 y 10 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, sus dos siguientes hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad y su ultima hija estudia en una escuelita. Su esposo es un profesional del volante por lo que labora prestando sus servicios como chofer de un taxi que es propio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.

Doña Rosa es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa,  actividad que la desarrolla hace 6 años en sus tiempos libres, también hace 10 años trabaja como secretaria en una radio taxi en la cual sus turnos son rotativos de domingo a domingo. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la  compra de cosméticos y ropa para continuar con su negocio. 

Su meta es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the El Crédito communal bank. She lives in the Cebollar area in the city of Cuenca. This city has a physical space full of beauty and cultural values. It was named a World Heritage Site in 1999. Its people are kind and friendly and keep their traditional cuisine, culture traditions.

Rosa is 40 years old. She is married and with her husband has 4 children, aged 23, 17, 16 and 10. Her oldest son is married and lives on his own. Her next two children go to a city high school and her youngest daughter is in elementary school. Her husband is a taxi driver who drives his own taxi. They do not own their own house and live in a relative's house. 

Rosa is a merchant who sells cosmetics and clothes. She has been doing this for 6 years in her free time. She has also worked for 10 years as a secretary at a taxi service where she works shifts Sunday through Sunday. 

She has been a member of the bank for 5 years and will invest the new loan in buying cosmetics and clothes to continue her business. 

Her goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por el sector del Crea en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad que tiene un espacio físico pródigo de belleza y valores culturales, los mismos que le dieron el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en Diciembre de 1999, su gente es amable, gentil, mantienen aun la gastronomía típica, la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Rosa tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, 4 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, uno de sus hijos trabaja y le ayuda en la económicamente y su ultimo hijo que tiene 17 años estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo le ayuda en su negocio ya que es jubilado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Rosa es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de ropa, su mercadería la vende en su casa y en días de ferias, también realiza adornos de fantasías los que aprendió en cursos.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 11 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir  en la compra de ropa para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su sueño es conservar su salud para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the El Crédito communal bank. She lives in the Crea area of the city of Cuenca. This city has a physical space full of beauty and cultural values. It was named a World Heritage Site in December of 1999. It's people are friendly and kind and maintain their traditional cuisine, culture and practices.

Rosa is 60 years old. She is married and with her husband has 6 children. Four of them are married and on their own. One of her chidlren works and helps her financially and her youngest son, who is 17, goes to a city high school. Her husband helps her in the business since he is retired. They do not own their own home and are renters. 

Rosa is a merchant who sells clothes. She sells her merchandise from her home and on market days. She also makes fantasy ornaments that she learned how to do in classes. 
 
She has been a member of the bank for 11 years and she is going to invest her new loan in buying clothes to continue in her business.  
 
Her dream is to stay healthy so she can continue her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Sanaha

texts.fr: Agée de 28ans, mère de 02 enfants (3ans et 09 mois) dont 01 à l’école, Madame Sanaha est mariée à un agent d’impôt. Elle est revendeuse de profession. Son activité est basée à Lomé et elle vend des céréales à toutes personnes. Elle a de nombreux clients et pour les satisfaire, sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises (céréales). Dans l’avenir, elle voudrait assurer la prospérité de son activité et permettre à sa famille de s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sanaha, age 28, is a reseller. She is married to a tax agent and the couple have two children, a 3-year-old who goes to school, and a 9-month-old. 

She sells cereals in Lomé. She sells to anyone, and her customer base is substantial. 

She is seeking a first loan from WAGES to stock up on cereals to meet customer demand. In the future, she wants to ensure the success of her activity and provide for her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old single man.  For the past three years, he has operated a grocery store selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project, but not profitable enough.

Mohammad is requesting a  US$1,500 youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of buying stocks of basic groceries that customers often request, such as rice, sugar and milk.  It will also help him to make improvements to the store, such installing additional shelves and painting. This will increase sales and Mohammad's income.

Mohammad is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell and to make store improvements

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por el sector del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad que tiene un espacio físico pródigo de belleza y valores culturales, los mismos que le dieron el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en Diciembre de 1999, su gente es amable, gentil, mantienen aun la gastronomía típica, la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Ana tiene 47 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de los cuales dos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja para sus gastos personales. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Ana nos comenta que se encuentra gozando de muy buena salud al igual que todos los miembros de su familia y agradece a Dios por ello.
 
Nuestra socia es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de juguetes, en este trabajo se encuentra hace 19 años, también trabaja arreglando casas. Con estos trabajos ella  ha podido aportar a la economía de su hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos.

En la cancelación de su crédito anterior  no ha tenido dificultad ya que en su negocio le ha ido muy bien, por este motivo está pidiendo un nuevo crédito para comprar juguetes para continuar con su negocio. La banca comunal le gusta porque en su grupo todas son cumplidas y solidarias.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the El Crédito communal bank. She lives in the Cebollar area of the city of  Cuenca. This city has a physical space full of beauty and cultural values. It was named a World Heritage Site in December of 1999. Its people are friendly and kind and maintain their traditional cuisine, culture and practices.

Ana is 47 years old. She is married and with her husband has 3 children. Two of them are married and live on their own. Her single son works to pay his personal expenses. Her husband is a taxi driver and works offering his services. They do not own their own home and are renters.

Ana tells us that she is in good health as are the members of her family and she thanks God for that.
 
Our member is a merchant and sells toys. She has done this job for 19 years and also works cleaning houses. With these jobs she has been able to contribute to the family finances and get her children ahead.

Paying off the previous loan was not difficult since it was going well in her business. That is why she is asking for a new loan to buy toys to continue her business. She likes the communal bank because in her group everyone is compliant and supportive.

loans.use: to purchase toys.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 40-year-old hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. 

He deals in motorcycle spare-parts, a business that he has run for 10 years. He started his business with capital 
from proceeds of maize growing.  Inadequate capital is a factor hurting the business. Godfrey wants a loan to buy more spare parts to sell.

He would like to educate his children and build a permanent home for his family.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 38-year-old ambitious man living in Kagadi, Uganda.

For ten years he has been selling produce, and the business is very profitable.  He started his business with capital from proceeds from growing maize and beans.  Inadequate capital does affect his business.  John wants a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

He would like to educate his six children up to the university.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Rafiatou's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Rafiatou, la responsable, âgée de 43 ans, est mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés. Elle distribue des parfums et des pommades depuis 08 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et ses clients sont essentiellement composés des habitants du quartier et de ses environs. Dans le souci d'élargir son commerce et de satisfaire les besoins sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de Finadev afin de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Rafiatou se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group of two people with joint liability. Rafiatou, the group leader, is a 43-year-old married mother of three children who go to school. 

She has been selling perfumes and pomades for eight years. She buys her stock in a market of Benin, and her customer base consists mainly of locals. 

To expand her activity and meet the needs of her customers, she requested and obtained a loan from Finadev. This credit will help to maximize her profits and provide for her children’s schooling. 

Rafiatou is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of perfumes, 3 boxes of pomades, and 2 boxes of powders of various brands.

loans.name: Tocte  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Tocte está formado por 5 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por la comunidad de Tocte que pertenece a la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca, comunidad que mantiene las tradiciones y costumbre de sus fiestas, como es el baile de disfrazados, banda de músicos, castillos, vaca loca, la quema de fuegos pirotécnicos, etc., la principal ocupación de los habitantes es la agricultura y la avicultura, cultivan maíz, fréjol, trigo y arveja, también laboran en la elaboración de sogas. Son personas amables y gentiles, su mayor orgullo es que aun mantienen vivas las tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Zoila María, tiene 52 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos, 4 de ellos son mayores de edad, trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su último hijo de apenas 11 años de edad está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo desde muy joven labora en la rama de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña Zoila María se dedica al duro trabajo del campo en donde trabaja labrando sus tierras,  sus cosechas son para el consumo de su hogar y si existe algún sobrante lo vende, también cría y vende cuyes, borregos, pollos y ganado. Para no perder el arte que sus padres le enseñaron se dedica a la elaboración de sogas.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de borregos, pollos y alimento para sus animales.

Su meta es  tener un mayor número de animales.
texts.en:
The communal bank Tocte comprises 5 women and one man who live in Tocte, a community in Jadan parish in Cuenca. The community celebrates the local traditions and festivals like the costume ball and the vaca loca [crazy cow], the castle fireworks, and more. Most of the residents farm or raise poultry, planting corn, beans, wheat, peas, and soy, and make rope. The people are friendly and kind and are very proud of keeping the local traditions alive.

Zoila María, 52, is one of the bank's members. She is married, and 4 of her 5 children from the marriage are adults who work and offer her financial support. Her youngest son is 11 and attends a small public school. Her husband has been a construction worker since he was very young, and they own their home.

Zoila María works very hard tilling her fields. Her harvests feed the family; if there is surplus food, she sells it. She also raises and sells guinea pigs, sheep, chicken, and cattle. She still makes rope so that she doesn't lose the skills that her parents taught her. She has been a member of the communal bank for 6 years, and she will use this new loan to buy sheep, chicken, and animal feed. Her goal is to own more animals.

loans.use: to buy sheep, chicken, and animal feed.

loans.name: Sènadé Julienne

texts.fr: Agée de 42 ans, Sènadé Julienne vit avec son époux et ses trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés dans une école de la ville. Elle dispose d'une boutique où elle vend des boissons de SOBEBRA et des liqueurs depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans les dépôts de la SOBEBRA les plus approches de sa boutique. Sènadé Julienne a sollicité et a obtenu un prêt à finadev en vue de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de combler les exigences de sa clientèle. Sènadé Julienne avec ses économies, veut participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et subvenir à ses besoins. Elle ambitionne aider son mari à construire de leur maison.
texts.en:
Sènadé Julienne, age 42, lives with her husband and their three children, who attend a local school. 

She has a shop where she has been selling SOBEBRA drinks and liqueurs for a few years. She buys her stock at the SOBEBRA outlets closest to her location. 

Sènadé Julienne requested and obtained a loan from Finadev to strengthen her business and meet customer demand. 

She plans to use her savings to help support her children’s schooling and to provide for her own needs. She also wants to help her husband with their project of building a house.

loans.use: to buy 15 cases of beverages and one carton of fruit juices.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Agée de 48ans, madame Akouvi a un enfant de 28ans. Elle exerce comme activité la vente de céréales et des charbons de bois à la maison à ses clients. Elle est à son troisième crédit de WAGES et n’a pas eu de difficultés pour rembourser les deux derniers. Ce montant lui servira à s’approvisionner en céréales et charbon de bois afin de vendre et tirer plus de profit. Elle veut épargner, agrandir son activité et pouvoir satisfaire les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouvi, age 48, is the mother of a 28-year-old child. She sells cereals and charcoal from her home. This is her third loan cycle with WAGES. She had no problems repaying the first two loans.
