Ella inicio con una fritanga en la actualidad desea aprovechar la oportunidad de un comedor que le están ofreciendo y es en ello que invertirá el crédito en la compra de productos para dar sus primeros pasos.
texts.en: Sra. Marlene is a hardworking and enterprising woman who sells food.  She started out with a fried foods establishment, but she is currently taking advantage of an opportunity to open a eatery where she can offer her dishes.  Marlene will invest in this loan in the purchase of products so that she can take the first steps in making this transition.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, basic grains, and other supplies.

loans.name: Gs Maura Catalina Ii Group

texts.es:
La Señora Ilser es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada a su trabajo, madre soltera tiene 2 hijos. Tiene su negocio en la aduana de Guasaule en el sur de Honduras. Desde hace mas de 10 años. Se dedica a Lo que es la pulpería.
Doña Ilser el préstamo lo necesita Para la compra de pollo, canes, lácteos, condimentos, maíz, café, azúcar y otros productos. Este crédito le ayudara ya que tendrá capital fresco para invertir ya que trabaja con créditos, también ella da créditos en su negocio a sus clientes.
Doña Ilser sus sueños es de poner un mini súper para a si tener mejores ingresos para bienestar de sus hijos.
Luisa se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en la aduana de Guasaule desde hace más de 12 años y actualmente vive con su esposo.
María se dedica a la venta de ropa americana desde hace más de 14 años madre de 2 hijos y actualmente vive con su esposo.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Isler is a very hard-working person dedicated to her business. She is a single mother with two children. For over ten years she has had her business in the customs office of Guasale in the south of Honduras. Her business is a grocery store. Isler is asking for a loan to buy chicken, soft drinks, milk products, condiments, coffee, sugar and other products. This loan will provide her with capital to invest since she works with loans. She also gives loans to her customers. 

Isler’s dream is to set up a mini-supermarket to improve her income and for the well-being of her children. 

Luisa has been earning her living selling groceries in the Guasaule customs office for over 12 years and currently lives with her husband. 

Maria has been earning her living selling American-style clothing for over 14 years and has 2 children. She currently lives with her husband. 

Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to buy chicken, soft drinks, milk products, condiments, coffee, sugar and other products for her business.

loans.name: Chou

texts.en:
Chou, aged 41, is a resident who permanently lives with her family, which includes her husband and three children, in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She started her business with agriculture many years ago. She plants and harvests rice and potatoes two seasons of the year. From the business income, she is able to support her standard of living and send all of her children to school. Chou is very happy because her husband is a good business partner. 

Chou aims to make improvements to her business and pursue a better living standard. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of KHR 1,500,000 to use local laborers to help transplant her rice. Through the loan help, Chou will be able to complete her farm work on time for the season. She believes that her hard work and patience will lead her to be a successful entrepreneur in the future.

loans.use: to use local laborers to help transplant her rice.

loans.name: Las Guerras De Fuego Group

texts.es:
Tengan ustedes un caluroso saludos de todos los peruanos!!!!!!!!!. Les presento al grupo LAS GUERRERAS DE FUEGO, que  está conformado por  9 miembros y está emprendiendo su cuarto ciclo. La mayoría de los socios ya se conocen entre sí, son muy responsables, entusiastas y sobre todo puntuales en sus pagos. Una de sus miembros es Juana  ella está casada con Rafael quien trabaja como chofer, como los ingresos únicos de sus esposo no satisfacía las necesidades de su hogar, Juanita emprendió con un pequeño negocio sin mucho esfuerzo, ya que empezó a criar pollos en su propia casa, para luego venderlos en las plazas y ferias, cerca a su casa sin descuidar las labores de ama de casa ya que para ese tiempo sus 2 hijas estaban estudiando. Poco a poco ese negocio fue creciendo gracias a que Juana no solo lo empezó a vender en los mercados y plazas, sino que empezó a vender a grandes y prestigiosos Restaurantes de su localidad. Este préstamo le servirá a Juanita para comprar alimento balanceado especial para sus aves y también para la compra de más aves, el sueño que ella tiene es de poder contar con su propio centro de acopio de aves, amplio y adecuado para poderlos repartir en grandes cantidades.
Ella viene trabajando con Edaprospo ya más de 2 años, y todos los prestamos han sido para invertir en su prospero negocio. Juanita es la segunda de la derecha viste con una chompa de color roja y con una cartera marrón en el brazo, la pequeña es la nieta de la Sra. Ester y en la fotografía falta Astrid.
Juana agradece por el apoyo que le brindan a ella y a su grupo!
texts.en:
Warm greeting to everyone from Peru! The group being presented is called “Las Guerreras de Fuego” (The Warriors of Fire), which consists of nine members who are starting their fourth loan cycle. Most of the members already know one another. They are responsible, enthusiastic, and most of all, punctual with their payments.

One of the members is Juana. She is married to Rafael, who works as a chauffeur. Living only on her husband’s income is not enough to meet the household needs, so Juana started a small business without much effort. She raises chickens from her home and then sells them in the town squares and at the fairs near her home. Juana is able to manage her business without neglecting her duties as a homemaker since she has two daughters who are in school. Little by little, her business has grown since she has also started selling to large prestigious restaurants in her town. Juana will use her loan to buy special balanced feed for her chickens, but she will also buy more birds. Her dream is to have enough cash to build her own chicken coop that is large enough to house a great number of birds.

Juana began working with EDAPROSPO more than two years ago. All of her loans have been invested in her prospering business. In the photo, Juana is the second person on the right wearing a red sweater and carrying a brown purse over her arm. The little girl in the photo is Sra. Ester’s granddaughter. Astrid is the member who is missing from the photograph.

Juana is grateful for the support that has been given to her and her group.

loans.use: to buy balanced poultry feed and more chickens.

loans.name: Ruth Del Carmen

texts.es: Ruth es originaria de la hermosa ciudad verde Esmeraldas, vino a vivir a Guayaquil como muchos para lograr mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella vive en el Guasmo sur de Guayaquil donde tiene su domicilio propio. Se dedica a la venta de comida la cual empezó cuando se separo de su esposo y quedo a cargo de sus 2 hijas. Emprendió este negocio hace varios años, fue su mama quien le enseño a preparar la sabrosa comida que vende y también que le ayuda en el negocio. Como la venta de comida no le alcanza también vende productos de cosméticos por catálogos, su día empieza desde temprano en la mañana realizando las compras de los productos que preparara para la venta aprovechando para realizar sus visitas a conocidos, amigos y clientes fijos. Su manera de trabajar es llevar los productos que tiene en stock para que lo vean y se decidan a la compra, tambien brinda ofertas para hacerlos mas atractivos. En su barrio es muy conocida y querida y por estar sola saliendo adelante con sus hijos se ha ganado el respeto y admiración de sus vecinos. Con el préstamo ella tiene pensado comprar sillas, mesas y una vitrina para exponer sus productos como perfumes, maquillajes, cremas brindando un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ruth is originally from the beautiful city of Verde Esmeraldas. She came to Guayaquil so that she could improve her quality of life. Ruth lives in Guasmo, which is south of Guayaquil and is also where she owns a house. She began selling food after she separated from her husband. Ruth has two daughters under her care. She started this business several years ago since her mother taught her how to prepare delicious food that she could sell. Her mother also helps with the business. Since selling food is not enough, Ruth also sells cosmetics through catalogs. Her day begins very early in the morning since she must buy supplies for preparing the dishes that she will sell to acquaintances, friends, and established customers. Ruth is well-known and loved in her neighborhood. Raising her children alone has earned her the respect and admiration of her neighbors.

With this loan, Ruth has plans to buy chairs, tables, and a display case for exhibiting products such as perfumes, make-up, and crèmes. This will enable her to provide quality service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her eatery and a display case for exhibiting cosmetics.

loans.name: Malengo Group

texts.en:
Omary, who is in his mid 20s, is married. He has been running a library for two years now. He works from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He has used the previous loans to buy telephone chargers, telephone batteries, and to take care of household expenses and has paid back his loans successfully. He wants a loan to restock the missing items in his library. His dream is to own an international library.

Omary will share this loan with his loan group "Malengo", 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in his library.

loans.name: Kwembe Group

texts.en:
Mercy is in her late 40s and single with two children who attend school.  For the past year, she has been selling food. Mercy works every day from 6:30 in the morning through 6:00 in the evening and is able to make a very small monthly profit. 

Mercy is requesting her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more stock of food to sell to more customers. She will share her loan with her loan group "Kwembe." This group has 10 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. In the future, Mercy's dream is to one day own a hotel.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell to more customers

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som is 56 years old and the widowed mother of four children, two of whom are married. She runs a general store in the Baray district, where she lives with her family. Som sells a variety of merchandise such as snack foods, sweets, spices, different ingredients, soft drinks, and vegetables. Her business has become the second source of the family's  income after rice farming. Som's son is working on probation at a tour company, specializing in driving cars for local and foreign people. In order to pass his probationary period and become part of the formal staff, he must qualify for another category of driving license that shows he has the capacity to manage a bus with over 20 passengers. 

Som is requesting a 300 USD loan to pay for her son's driving test and license fees. She hopes that her loan will help her son to improve his employment opportunities. In the future, Som wants to increase the product offerings at her store to satisfy her customers and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for her son's driving test and license fees

loans.name: Rwenyonyozi Bakyaara Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Eriya is a 40-year-old married man with five children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For the past five years, he has been a farmer who mainly grows Irish potatoes. Eriya used to farm on hired land but after two good harvests he was able to buy his own land. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations affect his farming activities.

Eriya is requesting a loan to buy Irish potatoes to plant. He is a member of the loan group "Rwenyonyozi Bakyaara Tweimuke" and each group member will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. In the future, Eriya's dream is to venture into mechanized agriculture.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes to plant

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay is just 23 years old. She is married and responsible for one young child and an infant. She lives in Baray district with her spouse, her mother, and her two young kids. To earn a living, Lay is a farmer. Her husband works as a barber in the local community. Lay usually grows dry-season rice because there is too much water during the rainy season, which can damage her rice crop. Her land is located in a lower part of Cambodia.

Lay is requesting a 700,000 KHR loan to purchase necessary barber tools to help her husband’s business. She believes that her loan will help develop husband's business and thereby increase her family's household income.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her husband’s barber shop

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, who appears in the picture, is a 39-year-old man who is married and the father of three sons. He is a worker who earns a low income that is not enough to cover his family's needs.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help cover the costs of purchasing new laptop. His loan will enhance his computer skills and increase his knowledge.

loans.use: to purchase new laptop computer

loans.name: Butunduzi Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Gideon is a 45-year-old married man with six children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.

For the past twenty years he has been growing Irish potatoes.  With the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees and buy more land.

 He has a personal goal of educating his children and a business goal of expanding his business into new market areas.

Gideon wants a loan to pay workers who are tilling his land in preparation for the next season.  He has a problem of seasonal weather changes which greatly affect quantity and quality of his yeilds.

He is a member of the Butunduzi Tweimukye group, where each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.

loans.use: To pay workers tilling his land for next season.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 31 years old and live in Ganta with his wife and 8-month-old baby.  Shadrack is a high school graduate.  

Since 2008 he has operated a shop where he sells shoes, slippers, jackets, etc,    He started this business with help from his father.  The problems he faces are the price of goods and the cost of transporting goods to his shop. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes, slippers, jackets, etc.,  for his business.  He likes how his business keeps him busy and gives him  independence.  His plans are to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more shoes, slippers, jackets, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Cristina Elizabeth

texts.es: Cristina de 23 años vive en Isla Trinitaria sector sur urbano de Guayaquil. La casa donde vive es de cemento y tiene todos los servicios básicos como agua, luz, alcantarillado y camino pavimentado. Ella trabaja en la atención al público en el bar de la escuela que es propiedad de su mamá, empezó cuando le dieron el local para que lo administrara dentro de la institución. Como tenía ganas de salir adelante fue a la universidad y obtuvo el título de profesora para poder dar clases. Ahora es profesora y microempresaria en la escuela en la que esta desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. Los productos que vende en su bar son gelatinas a $ 0.25 ctv galletas a $ 0.30 ctv papitas a $ 0.35 ctv. Atiende sola porque la escuela solo cuenta con 180 niños y tener una ayudante no le conviene para sus ganancias y porque el local es pequeño. El préstamo que solicita es para comprar una tostadora, licuadora, nevera pequeña y mercadería con esto podría vender variedad de productos. En el futuro va a colocar un local en el cual venderá productos de belleza ya que también se dedica a este tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Cristina, 23 years old, lives on Trinitaria Island, a southern urban area of Guayaquil. The house she lives in is made of cement and has all the basic services such as water, light, a sewer system, and a paved road. 

She works in customer service in the school's cafe, which is owned by her mother. Cristina started when the cafe was given to her to manage within the institution. Since she wanted to move forward, she went to college and earned a teaching degree so she could teach classes. Now she is an instructor and small businesswoman at the school. She works there from 7 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon. The products she sells at the cafe are jello for $.25, cookies for $.30, and potato chips for $.35. She works there alone because the school only has 180 students, so it is not beneficial to have an assistant because it would affect her profits at such a small cafe. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a toaster, a blender, a small refrigerator, and merchandise so she can sell a variety of products. In the future, she is going to invest in a place where she will sell beauty products, since she also works in selling these products.

loans.use: to buy a toaster, a blender, a small refrigerator, and merchandise

loans.name: Taiwah

texts.en:
Tawah is 35 years old and lives in the Ganta area.  She is married, with four children, aged 5 to 14, all living at home and attending school. 

For the past eight years, she has been involved in the sales of fashion clothes. Tawah has requested a loan to purchase more fashion clothes in order to turn her business into a bigger one. She has faced problems with changing USD to Liberian dollars. 

She started this business by running a cook shop (a local restaurant) and learned this one from friends.  What she likes about this business is that she makes new friends and meets people each and every day.  It makes her proud to have money in her home every day. 

In future she wants to open another shop, near the present shop.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Juventud Y Desarrollo - Chupaca Group

texts.es:
Saludos de todos sus hermanos peruanos!!!!!!!!!, hoy les hablare de Teodora, ella pertenece al grupo JUVENTUD Y DESARROLLO - CHUPACA, este grupo ya viene tranajando con EDDAPROSPO  ya más de un año, esta conformado por 9 personas entre hombre y mujeres, un grupo muy carismatico y muy solidario entre sus socios. Teodora es una mujer de 41 años, casada con 2 hijos, el mayor de 12 años y el segundo de tan solo tres años, ella viene trabajando en este negocio mas de 6 años, todo comenz{o por que a ella, no le alcanzava con lo que su esposo ganaba, su hijo mayor ya tenia que entrara a estudiar a una escuela y los gastos de sus estudios no podian ser cubiertos con lo poco que ganaba su esposo, eso hizó que Teodora inicie vendiendo algunas hortalizas que sembrabtra en el huerto de su propia casa, y como sus clientes le pedian otroas verduras ella decidó implementar su negocio comprando otras verduras que ella no podia cultivar.

Ella comprará con el prestamo solicitado papas, cebollas, ajos, y otras verduras en gran cantidad para que sus ganacias sean mayores, ella tiene el sueño de que en un tiempo tenga sus propio puesto de ventas ya que ella solo vende sus verduras de manera ambulatoria en diferentes mercados y plazas de su localidad.
Mejorando sus ingresos, Teodora está segura que podrá darles a sus hijos todo lo que ella no ha tenidcuando era pequeña, ya que sus padreseran de condición muy humilde.
Teodora no encarga darle gracias a cada uno de los invierten en todas las historias de la gente trabajadora.
teodora esta vestida con un polo y mandil de color rojo y es la segunda de la derecha, y esta ubicada en la segunda fila.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!  Teodora belongs to the group Juventud y Desarrollo-Chupaca (Youth and Development-Chupaca).  This group has already been working with EDAPROSPO for more than a year.  It is made up of nine people, among them one man and the rest are women.  It is a very charismatic and supportive group among its members.  Teodora is a 41-year-old woman, married with two children, the oldest is 12 years old and the second child is only three years old.  She has been working in this business for more than six years.  Everything began because what her husband earned wasn’t enough as her oldest child had to begin to study in a school and the expenses of those studies weren’t able to be covered with the little amount that her husband earned.  This made Teodora start selling some vegetables that she planted in the garden of her own house and as her customers asked her for other vegetables she decided to implement in her business buying other vegetables that she couldn’t cultivate.

With the requested loan she will buy a large quantity of potatoes, onions, garlic and other vegetables so that her earnings will be better.  She dreams of a time when she has her own stall for her sales since she only sells her vegetables as a street seller in different markets and squares in her town.  Improving her income, Teodora is sure that she will be able to give to her children everything that she didn't have when she was young, since her parents were in a very humble condition.

Teodora gives thanks to everyone who invests in all of the stories of hardworking people.  

Teodora is dressed in a polo shirt and red apron and is the second person from the right in the second row.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, garlic, onions, etc.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is age 30 and lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of looking after his three children. For ten years he has been practicing farming, and he sold his cows given to him by his father to buy land and start farming. Price fluctuations and inflation hinder his activities. His dream is to educate his children and diversify the business. Geofrey intends to use the loan facility to buy agro inputs such as fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy agro inputs such as fertilizers and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en: Rogers used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He is a 32-year-old married man living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a clinical officer and sole bread winner for his family. His challenge is the increasing prices making the cost of living high and delays in salary payments at his place of work. His dream is educating his children and self-education. Rogers needs this loan to renovate his house.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul is age 33 and lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of looking after 4 children. For 6 years, he has been operating a butcher shop, which he started with his personal savings. Price fluctuations and inflation hinder his activities. His dream is to educate his children and diversify the business to include hides and skin. Abdul wants a loan to buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy cows for his butcher shop

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is age 29 and married with a child. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. For 4 years he has been operating a wholesale shop; he got the start-up capital from his father. Price fluctuations, inflation, and theft hinder his business. His dream is to educate his children and diversify the business to include a spare-parts shop. Julius wants a loan to buy sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar to sell

loans.name: Fahmy

texts.en:
Fahmy is 32 years old, a married man who has three children and who works hard, has a bright future ahead of him and dreams of seeing his business established. He lives in Taiz, Yemen.

This business is a grocery store where he sells groceries in general. He's determined to get ahead and he's dynamic as far as his business goes. It is visited by many customers due to the owner's friendliness and the variety of merchandise available in the store, which has been open for many years.

He currently needs to get a loan, because he needs capital in order to stock up his business with various products demanded by his customers. He intends to keep his customers satisfied and therefore expand his clientele, which is his main goal.

He wishes to get a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to buy canned foods and soft drinks. That way he'll increase his profits so he can support his family and cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy canned foods and soft drinks for his business

loans.name: Kondoa Group

texts.en:
Elisia, who is in her early 60s, is married with five children, two of whom go to school.  The three of them are grown-ups.  She has been selling second-hand clothes since 2009.  She works from 9.00am to 4.00 pm daily and is able to make a snall monthly profit.  

This will be her 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used her previous loans to buy a TV set, bought a piece of land, paid school fees and has repaid all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to  buy more second-hand clothing to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to build her house.

Elisia will share this loan with her loan group "Kondoa" with 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothing to resell.

loans.name: Esmael

texts.en:
Esmael is 34 years old, a hardworking and optimistic person. He is married and raising two children. He has been involved in farming business for over eight years. As a father he has sacrificed many years working in this activity just to satisfy the needs and wants of his family. He wants to promote their lives through his endurance and hard work.

Esmael is requesting a loan in the amount of 25,000 pesos to buy 5 sacks of seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. These inputs are very much important to develop his business and he will be very much happy if his requested loan is approved.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en: Ferdinand, 52, is a hard-working and painstaking person. He is married and has raised 7 children through his farming business. He always gives his best in his source of income in order to achieve best result. To easily obtain this, he is asking for additional working capital in the amount of P15,000 to buy 2 bags of seeds, 5 bags of fertilizers and pay for labor costs. He hopes through this loan, he will able to yield abundant crops that will attain an improvement of their lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of seeds, 5 bags of fertilizers and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Korto

texts.en: Korto is 30 years old and lives in Ganta. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have two children, ages 5 and 8, who are presently attending school. For the past ten years she has been running a shop selling dishes (cups, plates, bowls, spoons, etc.) She makes a lot of profit, since she is the only one who sells quality dishes in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase dishes for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase dishes (plates, cups, bowls, spoons, etc.) for her business

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a 29-year-old man with a child living in Masindi, Uganda. For two years he has been farming, and the business has been very lucrative since he bought more land with the proceeds. He is challenged with price fluctuations, inflation, and unpredictable seasonal weather changes. His dream is to build a permanent house and diversify his business to include a piggery and poultry projects. Nicholas wants a loan to pay for labor and buy seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy seedlings for planting

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man is 46 years old and the widowed mother of an adult child who currently works as a laborer to contribute income to the family. Man lives in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She was born there and grew up on a family farm and has learned farming practices from her parents very well. Man grows seasonal crops, such as rice, potatoes, and vegetables, on her inherited land and typically earns 20,000 KHR each day. 

Man is requesting a loan to buy bulk bamboo shoots wholesale from a plantation to sell them to local vegetable vendors for a profit. She is eager to increase her household income and elevate her family's standard of living. Man hopes to have a good return from her investment and will reinvest her income in her farm and save some for family emergencies.

loans.use: to bulk buy bamboo shoots from a plantation to trade

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
This is Juditha, 56, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, who works as a farmer. Together with her husband, Juditha manages her household while operating her business. She operates a food stall and works hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses.  In the Philippines, the working community and most of the families, eat home-cooked meals in the evening, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is both a family tradition and a matter of convenience and frugal living as it is considered a waste of money and time to cook food only for one or two persons since buying cooked rice and prepared food costs less than raw food. Juditha's regular customers are her neighbors and local community members and she earns a minimum of 500 PHP in daily sales. 

Juditha is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of ingredients such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.  Juditha dreams that her business will grow and expand. She also wants to financially help her family. Juditha faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and products to prepare food

loans.name: Jose Heriberto

texts.es:
Don José, se dedica a su pequeño negocio de Reparadora de zapatos, carteras y mochilas, ofreciéndole a sus clientes calidad en su trabajo, ofreciendo cambio de chapitas, plantillas, costura, pegado, cambio de broches y mas, desde hace 16 Años trabaja en esto tipo de negocio, Don José ha logrado instalar su pequeño taller en su casa de habitación, hasta donde llegan sus clientes, también vende por mayor a las personas que se dedican a reparar zapatos de manera ambulante, ofreciéndoles buen precio y calidad, gracias a los ingresos que recibe de su negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, su actividad comienza desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde , todos los días de la semana.
Don José esta solicitando crédito por la cantidad de L. 15,000.00 para invertirlo en la compra de  suela, plantillas, chapitas y otros, espera contar con el apoyo de PRISMA para surtir su negocio.
Don José su sueños es tener salud y su negocio en buen funcionamiento para siempre apoyar a su familia.
Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Julio 2012
texts.en:
José works at his small business as a shoe cobbler and repairer of bags and backpacks, offering his customers quality in his work.  He replaces taps, insoles, stitching, gluing, clasps and more.  He has been working in this type of business for 16 years.  José has succeeded in installing a small workshop in his home, where his customers come.  He also sells wholesale to people who work door to door repairing shoes, offering them a good price and quality.  Thanks to the income that he has received from his business, he has been able to help his children get ahead.  His work begins at 7:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening, every day of the week. José is requesting the loan for the amount of 15,000.00 lempira (Honduran currency) to invest in the purchase of soles, insoles, taps, and other items.  He hopes to count on the support of PRISMA to stock his business.

José 's dreams are to be healthy and to have his business function well so that he can always support his family.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – July 2012

loans.use: to purchase soles, insoles, taps, and other items for his business.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: Fares is a 43-year-old married man. He has 7 children and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has built a small house and wants to complete it. He inherited the land from his dad. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 YER from AMB to help him cover the costs of purchasing cement and iron. This will ensure him better living conditions.

loans.use: to help him cover the costs of purchasing cement and iron for his house

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita lives with her partner and has three children. Two of her children are settled in marriage, while the youngest is still studying. For the past three years, Rosita has been buying and selling recycled materials. She didn't finish her studies because of a lack of financial resources. Based on her life experience, she wants her youngest child to finish her studies. Rosita patiently runs her business to increase her income and support her child's studies and give her a better way of life.

Rosita is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy recycled materials to sell. Her loan will improve her business, help her support her family, and cover increased household expenses. Rosita hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es: Carlos de 34 años vive en Libertad donde tiene una tienda que abrió hace varios años. Empezó el negocio un día al observar que frente a su casa estaba la escuela y por los alrededores no había tienda, vio la oportunidad y la aprovecho. Al principio le puso la dedicación necesaria para obtener los resultados que esperaba y se siente satisfecho de haberlo conseguido, ahora es muy conocido. A pesar de tener una buena acogida no le alcanzaba para cubrir su gastos por lo que realiza otros trabajos para poder mantenerse, cuando el no está su hermana le ayuda con la atención, los productos que más vende son colas, jugos, snack ya que al salir de la escuela los estudiantes son sus mayores clientes. El préstamo que Carlos está solicitando es para la compra de inventario. A futuro él espera poder hacer crecer su negocio de tal manera que pueda hacerle ampliaciones.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 34, lives in Libertad, where he has a store that opened several years ago.  He started the business when he one day observed that there was a school in front of his house, and there was no store in the surrounding area.  He saw the opportunity, and he took advantage of it.

In the beginning he put forth the necessary diligence to get the hoped for results.  He is happy to have done it.  Now he is very well-known.  In spite of being well-received, he does not get enough to cover his expenses.  

Therefore, he does other jobs in order to be able to support himself.  When he is not there, his sister helps him tend to the store.  The products that he sells the most are colas, juices and snacks.  This is because when they leave the school the students are his biggest customers.

Carlos will use the requested loan to buy inventory.  In the future he hopes to be able to make his business grow in such a way that he is able to expand it.

loans.use: to buy colas, juices, and snacks.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is a farmer from Lasam. He has been raising corn since he married his wife Elsie 23 years ago. Rogelio also plants fruits and vegetables to provide an additional source of income. He harvests the produce and his wife sells it at the market. 

Rogelio is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan to buy two bags of corn seed and fertilizer and pesticide to use on his farm. His loan will help him to maintain and preserve his farming business in good quality. Rogelio would also like to develop his vegetable business to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for his farm

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Managing a farming business requires strong determination, strong body, and hard work in order to attain abundant blessings from it. So Efren, a farmer in the village of Lasam is doing his best to obtain these traits. Enough funds are also one of the vital needs of such activity. 

Efren wants to yield bountiful crops to provide his family a comfortable life, so he is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 for maintenance of his business. It would be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides. He hopes to achieve his wish loan to make his dream possible.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Rosario Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Rosario del Socorro es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una fritanga, comideria, frescos y gaseosa negocio que inicio hace 9 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos  para el negocio.
Con las ganancias del crédito anterior ella realizo un baño.
texts.en: Rosario del Socorro is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has a business in which she sells fried snacks, fresh food, and refreshments. She started the business 9 years ago. She will invest the loan into buying products for her business. With the profit she earned from her previous loan, she built a bathroom.

loans.use: to buy oil, firewood, bananas, cheese and fruit, etc.

loans.name: Rosa De Saron Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa de Saron lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Ana del Socorro quien vende nacatamal y comida desde hace 2 años negocio en el que invertirá el crédito para aumentar su negocio. 
Las otras integrantes son Lilia quien vende ropa desde hace 1 año e Ivania quien vende comida desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The Rosa de Saron group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising women. One of these women is Ana del Socorro, who sells nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and other food. She has worked in this business for 2 years. She will invest the loan into increasing her business.

The other members are Lilia, who has been selling clothes for 1 year, and Ivania, who has been selling food for 2 years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, perishables, and meat

loans.name: Loeurng

texts.en:
Loeurng is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Prey Chor district with her family: her husband and two teenaged children, who are attending the local school. Loeurng and her spouse work together farming the same rice field to provide an income for their family. Loeurng and her husband aim to provide further education for their children to help them earn degrees and have a better future. To increase the family's income, Loeurng’s husband wants to open a tuk tuk (transportation) business. 

Loeurng is requesting a 2,000,000 KHR loan to purchase a motorcycle trailer for her husband's new business. She believes that, through the help of her loan, she and her husband will be able to financially secure their family and ensure good living conditions for their children.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle trailer for her husband's business

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза жительница города Исфара. Ей 24 года. Она не замужем. Живет с родителями. Фируза вместе с сестрой занимается торговлей. Она имеет собственный магазин, где работает продавцом. У нее магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара. В этой области Фируза работает более семи лет. Она просит кредит для покупки продуктов.
texts.en: Firuza is a resident of the city of Isfara. She is 24 years old. She is not married. She lives with her parents. Firuza and her sister have a small shop where they sell an assortment of goods. Firuza has been in this line of business for over 7 years. She has requested a loan to purchase groceries.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Hukmatullo

texts.ru: Хукматулло проживает в городе Дангара. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Хукматулло имеет средне - специальное образование, он бухгалтер. По специальности он проработал десять лет. Также Хукматулло занимается животноводством. В этой области он пять лет. Хукматулло берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Hukmatullo lives in the city of Dangara. He is 52 years old. He is married and has four children. Hukmatullo has a specialized secondary education; he was trained as an accountant and worked in his field for 10 years. Hukmatullo also raises livestock and has been doing this for five years. He is taking out a loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Teresa Caludina

texts.es: Teresa es madre soltera de 3 niños quienes están en esta escolar, por ellos empezó el negocio de la venta de cangrejos. El negocio al que se dedica lo realiza toda su familia y decidió unírseles como propietaria ya que no encontraba trabajo. El trabajo es muy cansado ya que vende por libras por lo cual tiene que pelar en grandes cantidades, lo que más se daña en el proceso son las manos aunque utiliza guantes se corta en varias ocasiones.  Ella empieza su labor junto a dos hermanos desde las 3 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, venden cangrejo por planchas vivos o sacados por libra siendo los últimos los más caros. En el barrio donde vive Teresa es muy conocida por ser una de las fundadoras, llego al Guasmo cuando recién se estaba poblando motivo por el que pudo comprar su casa, el barrio es tranquilo y gracias a Dios no ha tenido problemas. El crédito lo utilizara para comprar cangrejos por planchas, también camarón y 3 vitrinas para mantener el producto fresco.
texts.en:
Teresa is a single mother, and she has three school age children.  They are the reason that she started the business of selling crabs.  Her whole family devotes itself to the same business that she does.  She decided to join them as the proprietress because she could not find work.

The work she does is very tiring because she sells by the pound.  She has to peel great quantities.  During the process her hands get hurt the most.  Even though she uses gloves, she gets cut on various occasions.  She starts her work together with two siblings at three in the morning and works until six in the evening.  

They sell crabs in bundles or by the pound, the latter being the most expensive.  Terese is well-known in her neighborhood for being one of the founders.  She arrived in Guasmo when it was just being populated, which is the reason she was able to buy a house.  The neighborhood is peaceful, and, thank God, they have not had problems.

She will use the loan to buy bundles of crabs.  She will also buy shrimp and three display cases to keep the product fresh.

loans.use: to buy crabs and shrimp.

loans.name: Betty  Y.

texts.en: Betty is 37 years old and lives in Ganta. She is married and has a child, age 6, that is presently in school and lives at home. For the past years, she has been selling fashion and used clothes of all kinds in the market. She has a lot of customers and makes lots of profit, since she is the only one who sells both clothes, especially during the Christmas season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion and used clothes for her business. She plans to expand her business and send her child to a quality school.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion and used clothes for her business

loans.name: Froven Vicente

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúne el Banco Comunal Estrella Luminosas, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar vive el Señor Froven, tiene 49 años, es divorciado y de esa relación tiene dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, en la actualidad mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 10 y de 6 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. Su mujer le ayuda en su labor en el campo.

Nuestro amigo para llevar el pan diario a su hogar se dedica a varias actividades, él tiene un carrito en el cual realiza fletes para quienes lo necesitan, además  también en toda época del año se dedica a la agricultura ya que tiene sus parcelas muy cerca del rio y a través del bombeo de agua realiza los regadíos en sus cultivos, en la actualidad tiene cultivos de arroz, verduras, plátano entre otras cosas, productos que el mismo  vende en los mercados de Portoviejo cuando cosecha. 

Este crédito es para pagar la mano de obra en la recolección del arroz ya que de allí tiene que guardarlo un tiempo hasta que seque y su precio mejore más. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan.
texts.en:
The Estrella Luminosas communal bank meets in the Crucita Parish of the Portoviejo Canton. This area is known for its beautiful surrounding beaches that are visited by many domestic and foreign tourists. It is known as "Crucita la Bella," or Crucita the Beautiful.

Froven lives here. He is 40 years old, divorced, and has two adult children from that marriage. Currently, he is in a common law marriage from which he has two children who are 10 and 6 years old and both attend school. His wife helps him with the field work.

Our friend works in various jobs in order to provide his family with necessities. He has a trolly in which he provides charters for those who need it. He also works in agriculture throughout the entire year, since he has plots of land very close to the river. By pumping the water, he irrigates his crops. He currently has rice, vegetable, plantain and other crops. He also sells these products in the Portoviejo markets when he harvests them.

This loan is to pay workers, who harvest the rice. He has to keep the product for awhile until it dries and the price improves. This is his third loan with the communal bank and he likes it because of the help it provides him.

loans.use: To pay workers

loans.name: Cheap

texts.en:
Cheap is a hardworking woman involved in rice-farming and hog-raising business for the major source of her income. She has been working in these two businesses for over 20 years, and they allow her to cover her daily expenditures, especially food. Cheap is now 38 years old and became a widowed mother a few years ago. She is responsible for three children, one of whom is already married and lives independently. Recently, all of her children quit studying due to the financial constraints of the family. Now they are working for a garment factory to help their mother earn income.

With the amount she requested from Kiva lenders, Cheap would like to purchase an extra plot of farmland to increase the volume of her productivity. This loan will help her work out her business and increase her household income in the coming future.

loans.use: to purchase an extra plot of farmland to increase the volume of her productivity.

loans.name: Estrella Group

texts.es:
El grupo la estrella lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Ana quien comercializa ropa y cosméticos desde hace 5 años y actualmente tiene un pequeña venta en la que invertirá el crédito en granos básicos. La meta de esta joven es terminar sus estudios superiores.
Las otras integrantes son Yamileth quien se dedica al comercio de ropa, perfumes y cosméticos desde hace 8 años y Liseth del Carmen quien vende cosméticos y perfumes desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
The group “The Star” is comprised of three hard-working people.  One of them is Ana, who has been selling clothing and cosmetics for 5 years.  Currently, she has a small sale that she will invest in basic grains.  The goal of this young woman is to finish her higher education.

The other members are Yamileth, who has dedicated herself to selling clothes, perfumes and cosmetics for 8 years, and Liseth del Carmen who has been selling cosmetics and perfumes for 6 years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains.

loans.name: Matilde Alexandra

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar vive la señora Matilde, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 18, 15 y 10 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio mientras que el menor en escuela. El marido tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz.

Nuestra amiga tiene una tienda en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras, frutas,  bebidas entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días y los días domingos ella también prepara almuerzos para vender con lo cual se gana un dinero extra, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden y están desocupados, pero por lo general es nuestra amiga la que mas pasa en su negocio. Tiene seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 ciclos  y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the town of Rocafuerte, the members of the Patito Donald cooperative bank meet every fifteen days.  This area is famous for the candies made by the townspeople, which are known throughout the whole country, and for the quality of its friendly and hard-working residents.

Here is where Matilde, 37, lives with her partner with whom she has three children ages 18, 15 and 10.  The two older ones are in school, and the youngest is also studying.  The husband has an auto repair workshop.

Our friend has a store in her house.  There, she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, vegetables, fruits and beverages, among other items.  She works every day, and on Sundays she also prepares lunches to sell so she can earn extra money.  Her children help her with her work when they have free time but, in general, she is the one that spends the most time working at the business.  She has dedicated herself to this activity for six years, and things are going very well.

She will use this loan to better supply her store, buying rice, sugar, oil, detergents, canned goods and other basic need products.  She has been in the cooperative bank for 6 cycles, and she likes it because of the help she gets in obtaining loans.  

Her goals are to forge ahead with her business, and to see her children excel professionally.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, canned goods, and other basic needs products.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.en:
This is Pastor, 56, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Rodelyn and a father to his children. He, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Pastor operates an ornamental plant business. He grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias, as well as a variety of hanging plants and others alike. He also grows local bananas and pineapples for extra income in his small farm. His regular customers are local tourists, neighbors, and the community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for his business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of his farm. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Pastor hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for pots, wire, fertilizers, and other things needed in his business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É docente e quadro do Ministério da Educação. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, barrotes, portas, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa e melhorar as condições de vida da sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de transporte da casa ao serviço.
texts.en:
Angela is the single mother of two children who go to school.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else besides them.  She is a teacher under the Ministry of Education.  She will use this loan to buy construction materials (cement, stone, beams, doors, etc.) to continue work on her home.

In the future, she hopes to finish her home and to improve her family's living conditions.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is that she lacks transportation from her house to her job.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, stone, beams, doors, etc.) to continue work on her home.

loans.name: Sonia Leticia

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sonia, tiene 35 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 15 y 8 años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela.
 
Nuestra amiga para salir adelante y mucho mas después de que separo de sus esposo se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un local en el centro de Rocafuerte en el cual vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, sandalias, carteras y muchos productos más, trabaja todos los días en su boutique,  de vez en cuando le ayudan sus hijos cuando ellos no están en sus estudios, ella lleva más de 12 años con su negocio el que según nos cuenta le permite sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para ir a comprar ropa, zapatos, carteras, etc. ya que necesita ahora que son las fiestas de su ciudad y es cuando más vende, esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y a bajos intereses.
 
Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
In the town of Rocafuerte, the members of the Patito Donald cooperative bank meet every fifteen days.  This area is famous for the candies made by the townspeople, which are known throughout the whole country, and for the quality of its friendly and hard-working residents.

Here is where we get to know Sonia, 35, who is divorced and has three children ages 17, 15 and 8.  The two older ones are in school, and the youngest is also studying. 

In order to get ahead and much after she separated from her husband, our friend dedicated herself to commerce.  She has a locale in the center of Rocafuerte where she sells all types of clothing, shoes, sandals, handbags, and many other products.  She works in her boutique every day and, occasionally, her children help her out when they are not studying.  She has been in this business for more than 12 years, which she tells us allows her to help her children get ahead.

This loan is for the purchase of clothing, shoes, handbags, etc., as she needs products because it is the time for the festivals in her city, which is when she sells the most items.  She has been with the cooperative bank since the beginning, and she likes it because the loans are quick and at low interest rates. 

Her dreams are to provide a better life for her children and to continue getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, handbags, etc.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 28-year-old married man with three children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells used clothes to earn a living and has been in this business for five years. The major hardship he's encountered is inadequate capital to buy what his clients demand. His dream is to have a big boutique with both men's and women's wear. In order to diversify his business and attract more customers, he also sells shoes. Robert intends to use this loan to buy shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This is Bella. She previously accessed a PHP 10,000 loan that she utilized to purchase farm inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and other tools for the maintenance of the farm. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Bella dreams to be able to give her all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Edson

texts.en: Edson used the previous loan for himself. He is 31 years old, married, and has children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a civil servant and has been in service for seven years. He still has a major challenge of not being qualified enough to gain promotions in his job. His dream is to educate his children and attain a master's degree for himself. Edson intends to use the loan facility to pay school fees for himself, as the new semester has started.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Felismina

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 1 filha que frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria com sua filha e sustenta mais 3 sobrinhos e 3 netos que vivem com ela. 	
Trabalha como auxiliar administrativo numa empresa privada. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (barrotes, chapas de zinco, aros, pregos, e outros) para a cobertura da obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa e iniciar um negócio após a sua reforma, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo de vida.
texts.en:
Felismina is a widow and the mother of one daughter who goes to school.  She lives in her own home with her daughter and also supports three nephews/nieces and three grandchildren who live with her.  She works as an administrative assistant at a private company.  WIth this loan, she will buy construction materials (beams, zinc sheets, nails, etc.) to put a roof on her home.

In the future, she hopes to finish her home and to start a business after her home is complete.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is the elevated cost of living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (beams, zinc sheets, nails, etc.) to put a roof on her home.

loans.name: Johanna Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar vive la señora Johanna, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 5 y 1 años de edad, su hija mayor este año empezó la escuela. El marido tiene un carro en el cual realiza fletes. 

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para su esposo y para un pequeño negocio de venta de agua en bidón que ella tiene en su casa, nos cuenta que parte del crédito lo utiliza su esposo para arreglos de su carro ya que este es la fuente de ingresos más importante que ellos tienen para salir adelante,  por lo general su esposo trabaja todos los días y mucho más los fines de semana que es cuando más movimiento hay en la ciudad, él transporta a las personas a los campos o lugares donde se quieran trasladar, él  lleva más de 8 años realizando esta labor que gracias a Dios les permite llevar el pan diario ala su mesa.
 
Este crédito es para comprar bidones de agua para la venta y repuestos para arreglar el carro de su esposo. Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro nuevo.
texts.en:
In the town of Rocafuerte, the members of the Patito Donald cooperative bank meet every fifteen days.  This area is famous for the candies made by the townspeople, which are known throughout the whole country, and for the quality of its friendly and hard-working residents.

This is the place where Johanna, 30, lives with her partner with whom she has two daughters aged 5 and 1.  Her husband has a car, which he uses to provide transportation services.

Our friend takes out a loan for her husband and for a small business she has selling canned water that she has in her house.  She tells us that she will use part of the loan to make repairs to her husband’s vehicle, given that it is the most important source of income they have for getting ahead.  In general, her husband works every day of the week, but much more on weekends when there is the most activity in the city.  He transports people to the countryside or places they want to move to.  He has been carrying out this work for more than 8 years, which, thank God, allows him to put food on the table on a daily basis.

This loan is for the purchase of cans of water to sell and repairs for her husband’s car.  She has been in the cooperative bank for 4 years, and likes it because of the help they give her with the loans.

Her dream is to buy a new car.

loans.use: to buy water in cans and parts for car repairs.

loans.name: Arnelfa

texts.en:
This is Arnelfa, She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed in the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Arnelfa hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhas que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É pedreiro e trabalha por conta própria. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, portas, aros, janelas, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa e poder crescer na sua careira de pedreiro, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a dificuldades financeiras e melhorar as condições de vida da sua família.
texts.en:
Miguel is married and is the father of two daughters who go to school.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone else besides them.  He is a mason and is self-employed.  With this loan, he hopes to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, doors, frames, windows, etc.) to continue work on his home.

In the future, he hopes to finish his home and to grow in his career as a mason.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenges are financial difficulties and improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, doors, frames, windows, etc.) to continue work on his home.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a María tiene 31 años de edad, está soltera  y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha brindado en este tiempo tanto la institución como sus compañeras del grupo. Ella estudio para Lic. En Ciencias de la Educación especialidad que culmino hace poco y que hoy le permite salir adelante.

Nuestra amiga trabaja como ayudante de una maestra en un jardín de infantes de la localidad, trabaja en las mañanas de lunes a viernes y en las tardes ella se dedica a su negocio, ella vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todas las tardes y los fines de semanas, también vende en su lugar de trabajo a las madres que llegan hasta allí o a sus compañeras de trabajo, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 4  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, es así como ella pudo pagarse sus estudios.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener un nombramiento en alguna escuela o colegio.
texts.en:
In the town of Rocafuerte, the members of the Patito Donald cooperative bank meet every fifteen days.  This area is famous for the candies made by the townspeople, which are known throughout the whole country, and for the quality of its friendly and hard-working residents.

This is where we get to know María, who is 31, single, and lives with her parents.  She has been with the cooperative bank for four cycles, and she likes it because of all the help the institution has provided for her as well as her companions in the group.  She studied for a degree in Education Sciences, a specialty that she completed not long ago and that helps her get ahead.

Our friend works as a teacher’s assistant at a nursery school in the area, working in the mornings from Monday to Friday.  In the afternoons, she dedicates herself to her business selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women).  She works every afternoon and weekends, and also sells in her workplace to the mothers who come by and to her workmates.  She leaves her products on credit, and charges every eight days.  She has dedicated herself to this activity for more than 4 years, things are going well, and this is how she was able to pay for her education.

This loan is for the purchase of perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.  This is her third cycle in the cooperative bank, and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to get appointed to a school.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
Lita tiene 43 años, en una mujer emprendedora y llena de aspiraciones. Tienen tres hijos de 28, 26 y 13 años junto al hombre con quien convive hace 29 años llamado José. Viven en casa de su suegra, donde tiene un espacio para su familia.

Su principal actividad es la venta de frutas cítricas, como naranjas, limones y mandarinas. Todos los días se dirige al puerto de la ciudad en espera de la llegada de los agricultores que traen sus productos directamente desde el campo, compra en sacos por cientos y ella se encarga de distribuirlos en cantidades menores o por unidades. Lleva en este negocio hace 8 años y siempre con la ayuda de su pareja, quien se encarga de movilizar los pesados sacos. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que desde muy pequeña ha aprendido a valorar el trabajo y a hacerle frente a las situaciones difíciles. Su negocio le genera los ingresos necesarios para sobrellevar los gatos básicos de su familia y espera que su situación económica siga mejorando con el paso del tiempo.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero. Además está convencida que seguirá siendo la socia puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas como lo hizo en los créditos obtenidos anteriormente. Le gusta pertenecer a al banco comunal en el que trabaja, ya que todos sus miembros son responsables y muy solidarios entre sí.

Con el monto solicitado, 2000 nuevos soles, comprará una mayor cantidad de frutas, por sacos. Su inversión diaria puede llegar hasta 500 soles y llega a obtener buenas ganancias de ese capital invertido.
texts.en:
Lita, 43, is an enterprising woman who is full of aspirations.  She and her husband have 3 children aged 28, 26 and 13.  She has lived with her husband, Jose, for 29 years.  They live in her mother-in-law's house, where there is room for the family.

Lita's main economic activity is selling citrus fruits, such as oranges, limes and mandarin oranges.  She goes out each day to the entrance of the city awaiting the arrival of the farmers who bring their products directly from the fields.  She buys in sacks containing 100 units, and she is in charge of distributing these in smaller quantities or by the piece.  She has had this business for 8 years now, and she always has the help of her partner, who is in charge of transporting the heavy sacks.  She really likes what she does, because ever since she was very young she was taught to value hard work and how to cope with difficult situations.  Her business generates the income she needs to cover the basic expenses of her family, and she hopes that her financial situation will continue to improve over time.

This is her 5th loan with MFP, and she is very pleased to know that she has financial support.  Also, she is sure that she will continue to be punctual and responsible with her payments as she was with her previous loans.  She likes belonging to her communal bank and participating in its work, because all of the members are responsible and very supportive of each other.  

With the sum of 2,000 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will buy a large quantity of fruit by the sack.  Her daily investment can return at least 500 soles, and so she will get good profits from this investment of capital.

loans.use: to buy citrus fruit in bulk to continue with her sales

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia lives in Ganta area. She is 36 years old and has three children between 4 and 10 years old that are in school and live at home. She stopped her education in the 10th grade. She is married and her husband is a businessman. For the past five [years], she has been running a shop where she sells auto parts, electronic accessories and others items. She started this business with money that she received from her husband. A problem she is facing is that sometimes customers are not available. She is requesting a loan to purchase more auto parts, electronic accessories and others items to attract customers. Her plan is to build a house for her children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more auto parts, electronic accessories and others items to attract her customers

loans.name: Burungu Karambi Wn Gp Group

texts.en: Patrick is a 40-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children up to the University level. He has been a retailer for four years, and his main hardship is inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand, however, he has a vision of expanding his business to include farming. Patrick needs a loan to buy salt, soap, and sugar to sell. He is a member of the above-mentioned group, where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan; that is why they are nine people even though only seven needed the loan.

loans.use: to buy salt, soap, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jenny María

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jenny, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 4 años, el  mayor  estudia en colegio y el menor en jardín de infantes. Su esposo  tiene un taller de ebanistería.
 
Nuestra amiga con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon y Esika (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Ella también parte del crédito  le da a su esposo para que el compre materia prima para elaborar los muebles que le mandan hacer sus clientes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y madera para el trabajo de su esposo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con los créditos les ha permitido salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The members of the Patito Donald Community Bank meet twice a month in Rocafuerte canton. It is an area known throughout the country for the delicious candy made by the local people and for their warmth, friendliness and ethic of hard work.

31-year old Sra. Jenny is one of the members. She is married and has two children aged 11 and 14. The older one is a high school student and the younger attends kindergarten. Her husband is a cabinetmaker with his own workshop.

In order to have an income of her own, Jenny sells Avon and Esika products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfume etc.) from catalogs. She goes door to door selling the products. She plans to give part of the loan to her husband so that he can buy wood to make the furniture that his customers have ordered. 

Jenny will use the loan to buy perfume, jewelry, cosmetics, lotions for her business, and wood for her husband. She has been in the Community Bank since it started, and enjoys being a member because the loans have helped her get on in life.

Her dream is to have a home of her own as she lives in rented accommodation at the moment.

loans.use: to buy perfume, jewelry, lotions, amd wood

loans.name: Linda

texts.es:
Linda tiene 41 años, tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 15, 10 y 2 años, su pareja es Abel, a quien conoció hace 20 años. Todos viven en la casa propia que construyeron a base de mucho trabajo.
Ella es asistente en el consultorio que ha constituido junto a su pareja desde hace 8 años, interviene de manera activa en corregir dolencias, alguna incomodidad dental o simplemente ayuda a mejorar la apariencia de una persona otorgándole una linda sonrisa. Trabaja al lado de su pareja y tienen un local alquilado cerca de su vivienda. Adicionalmente vende gaseosas, cosméticos y artículos de cuidado personal entre sus amigos, familiares y conocidos. Le gusta mucho su actividad, pues le permite llevar una adecuada organización de sus funciones y porque además le genera buenas ganancias gracias a las múltiples ventas que realiza a diario. Aunque ahora le está yendo bien, no siempre fue así, tuvo que padecer mucho para poder tener lo que ahora y espera seguir trabajando para poder seguir progresando.

Este es su préstamo número 16 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y que le brindan la oportunidad de continuar avanzando con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual como lo hizo en los créditos anteriores. Asegura que le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas muy responsables y muy solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado, 2000 nuevos soles, comprará amalgamas, carillas y porcelanas para la implementación de su laboratorio dental. Así mismo, invertirá en la compra de cosméticos y productos de perfumería para tener en stock, y también 10 cajas de gaseosas para continuar vendiendo en su casa.
texts.en:
Linda, age 41, has four children, ages 17, 15, 10, and 2.  She has known her life partner, Abel, for 20 years.  They all live in their own house, which they built with a great deal of work.

She is an assistant in the clinic that she and Abel set up eight years ago.  She is actively involved in treating ailments, dental discomfort, or simply helping to improve a person’s appearance with a lovely smile.  She works at her life partner’s side, and they have a rented place close to their house.

She also sells soft drinks, cosmetics, and personal care items to her friends, family, and acquaintances.  She really likes her business activity.  It allows her to carry out her roles in an organized manner.  Also, it generates good income thanks to the multiple sales she makes daily.  Even though it is now going well for her, it was not always this way.  She had to endure a lot in order to be able to have what she now has.  She hopes to continue working in order to be able to continue progressing.

This is her 16th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and that she is given the opportunity to continue advancing with her business.  She pledges, once more, to make her payments punctually as she has done with the previous loans.

She affirms that she is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are very responsible and very supportive people.
