She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy amalgamates, veneers, and porcelain to fit out her dental lab.  She will also buy cosmetics and perfume products to have in stock and ten cases of soft drinks in order to continue selling at home.

loans.use: to fit out her dental lab and to buy cosmetics and soft drinks in order to continue selling.

loans.name: Lupita

texts.es:
Lupita tiene 43 años, es una mujer dinámica y muy entusiasta. Su pareja es Edgardo, de 44 años, quien es su compañero durante mucho tiempo; son padres de Edgardo de 15 y Rubí de 6 años. 
Todos los días Lupita se dirige a la casa de sus amigos, vecinos y familiares en busca de vender alguna de las diferentes prendas de vestir que tiene para ofrecer. Cuando los clientes se ganan su confianza los deja en crédito y va a cobrar diario, semanal o en algunos casos quincenal. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 8 años y lo que más le gusta es que le permite tener tiempo para poder ejercer su profesión como profesora. Además, la venta de ropa, le significa una entrada adicional para su economía y así puede dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Desea seguir trabajando mucho y más adelante poder tener una boutique o un local comercial donde ofrecer sus prendas.

Este es el crédito número 16 que tiene con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo. Está convencida que seguirá siendo una buena socia, responsable de los créditos obtenidos. Le gusta pertenecer a su banco comunal porque todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre sí.

Con el monto solicitado, 2000 nuevos soles, comprará más ropa: blusas, camisas, pantalones y polos para hombres y mujeres, y otros accesorios para seguir ofreciendo nuevos diseños y modelos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lupita, 43, is a dynamic and enthusiastic woman.  Her partner Edgardo, 44, has been her companion for a long time; they are the parents of Edgardo, 15, and Rubi, 6. 

Every day, Lupita goes to the homes of her friends, neighbors and relatives to try to sell some of the various garments that she has to offer. When the customers gain her trust, she sells to them on credit and she collects on a daily, weekly, or in some cases, bi-weekly basis.  She has been doing this work for 8 years, and what she likes the most is that it allows her to have time to also practice her profession as a teacher.  Also, the sale of clothing provides an extra income for her household, allowing her to provide better living conditions for her family.  She wants to keep working hard so that in the future she can have a boutique or store where she could sell her clothing.

This is her 16th loan with MFP, and she is very pleased to know that she has financial support so that she can continue to increase her working capital.  She is certain that she will continue to be a good and responsible member of her communal bank with the loans she obtains.  She enjoys belonging to her communal bank, because all of the members are very responsible and supportive of each other.

With the sum of 2,000 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will buy more clothing, including: blouses, shirts, pants, polo shirts for men and women, and other accessories so that she can continue to offer the newest designs and styles of clothing to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and accessories to continue her sales

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase additional stocks of rice for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of rice. The more stock displayed at the store the better. More stock to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mary Jane hopes to be able to acquire a commercial stall for her business and aspires to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of rice for her business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora, dinámica y deseosa de progresar. Está casada  con Einer, quien es profesor, fruto de esa unión tienen dos hijos: Einer de 15 y Keiko de 13 años.
Ella se dedica a la costura y confección de ropa, actividad que aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional. Logró aprender todo lo necesario para desempeñarse en este oficio y ha sabido hacerse conocida ganándose algunos clientes. Para empezar instaló su propio taller en su vivienda, iniciándose con una sola máquina que compró con sus ahorros. Realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 5 años y lo que le gusta es poder contar con un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos del hogar y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ya que a su esposo no le alcanzaba con los ingresos que tiene en su  actividad como docente. Su deseo es continuar con esta actividad y ampliar su taller con otras máquinas de coser.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP y está contenta de saber que cuenta con un apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a ser responsable con el  pago de sus cuotas para tener un buen récord crediticio.
Con el monto solicitado, de 800 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales de costura; como telas, hilos, elásticas, botones, etc., buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Miriam, 40, is a dynamic and hardworking woman who has a desire to make progress.  She is married to Einer, who is a teacher, and together they have two children: Einer, 15, and Keiko, 13.

Miriam has a dressmaking business; she was taught to sew in an occupational education center.  She managed to learn everything she needed to perform this trade, and she has been able to make herself known in the market, gaining some customers.  To start out, she set up a sewing workshop in her house.  She started with only one machine that she bought with her savings.  She has been in this line of work for more than 5 years, and what she likes is to be able to count on a regular income to pay for the household expenses and provide a better quality of life for her family, because her husband's income as a teacher is not sufficient to do this.  She hopes to continue with this activity and expand her workshop with additional sewing machines.

This is her first loan with the MFP institution, and she is pleased to know that she can count on financial support to carry out her plans.  Therefore, she promises to be responsible with the payments on her loan so that she can maintain a good credit record.

With the 800 Peruvian soles she requests, she will invest in the purchase of sewing supplies, including: fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, etc.  She will buy these items in bulk to get the lowest prices.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies: fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Neak

texts.en:
Neak is 48 years old and a mother of three dependent children who are currently enrolling in a local school of Kampot province. She is a farmer and married to her spouse, a local policeman. She owns around two hectares of farmland for cultivating annual rice crops, earning approximately USD 2 per day. She has been operating this business for almost 30 years. Also, Neak raises cows for fattening and after about one year, she will sell them for profit. Raising cows for trading is a long-term investment for Neak.

To make her business become viable and profitable, Neak would like to have a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase a cow for raising. Neak is very happy that Kiva lenders help her in the business. She is appreciating and promises to pay her loan back punctually as schedule. In the future, Neak wants to own a farm, on which she will operate a cow fattening and breeding business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for raising.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
This is Analiza. She previously accessed a 23,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more stock of a variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
 
Analiza hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to gain strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and other products for resale in her business.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo engages in rice crop production to earn a living and meet his family's needs. He is 49 years old, is married and has five children. He expects to earn and save more income from his business to offer a bright future to his children. 

To attain his dream, he plans to maximize his farming business. This leads him to request a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. In the future, he hopes to acquire more revenue from his rice production in order to feel financially secure.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 41 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de decidida y alegre. Está separada del padre de su hijo Joseph, de 7 años. Vive en casa de su madre, con ella, sus tres hermanas, uno cuñado y su hijo. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas de la región como “juanes” (arroz envuelto en hojas), “patarashca” (pescado envuelto en hojas), siendo estos platillos muy consumidos por ser tradicionales de la zona, pero también prepara diversas comidas. Para eso, todas las tardes, instala una mesa en el frontis de su vivienda donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Lleva realizando este negocio desde hace 2 años, logrando ver crecer su clientela y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Le gusta su actividad, porque puede contar con un ingreso económico para apoyar con los gastos del hogar, además de estar en casa para atender a su pequeño hijo. Por lo contrario, no le gusta cuando llueve muy seguido, pues le dificulta la venta, aunque eso no la desanima. 

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP y está agradecida con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los créditos anteriores. Y se siente a gusto con su grupo, pues los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de los víveres e ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas, buscará variar su carta incluyendo los nuevos platillos que le están pidiendo sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jenny is 41 years old and is a hard-working and earnest woman.  She is resolute and cheerful as well.  She is separated from the father of her son Joseph, age 7. She lives in her mother's house, along with her mother, her three sisters, one brother-in-law, and her son.  

She sells typical foods from the region such as "juanes" (rice wrapped in leaves), and "patarashca" (fish wrapped in leaves).  These are very popular dishes for consumption since they are traditional foods from the area, but she also prepares various foods. For this reason, every afternoon she sets up a table at the front of her house where she kindly serves her customers, most of whom are neighbors. She has been doing this work for 2 years, managing to grow her clientele, and up until now doing it alone.  She likes her work because it provides income to assist with household expenses, in addition to allowing her to be at home to care for her young son. On the other hand, she does not like it when it rains very often, because it makes sales very slow, but that doesn't discourage her.

This is her third loan with the MFP institution and she is grateful for the financial support that helps her to advance her business.  Thus, she agrees to comply with the payment of their fees, as with the previous loans. She also feels comfortable with her group, since she considers the other members responsible and caring people.

With the amount requested, of 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency), she will invest in the purchase of supplies and ingredients needed to prepare her meals.  She will seek to vary her menu, including adding new dishes that her customers are requesting.

loans.use: To purchase the ingredients and supplies to prepare meals.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, 37-years-old, has been working hard for the past six years managing her business. She sells body cream, bath soap, washing soap, lapper, trousers, skirts, handbags, blouses, etc. She lives in West Point. Asha is married with three children, ages 18 to 22, that are attending school and live at home. Her husband is a government worker. 

A challenge she is faced with is the exchange rate (USD to LD). Her favorite part of her business is the amount of profit that she generates from her monthly sales and loan that she received from BRAC, since this is her second loan cycle from BRAC Liberia. She is very proud of her business because, with the profit and extra loan, she was able to buy more goods to increase her business and purchase a portion of land. She has requested a loan to purchase more body cream and spray, bath and washing soap, women's and men's shoes, roll-on, men's and women's trousers, blouses, etc., for her business. Her plan for the future is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream and spray, bath and washing soap, women's and men's shoes, roll-on, men's and women's trousers, blouses, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
This is Priscilla, age 40, who is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a single parent with four children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Priscilla operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community, and most of their families, only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking food for one or two people when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Priscilla hopes to have another store in her community and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the raw ingredients and products needed in her business

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 20 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Alexander, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y es el padre de su única hija, Ofelia de 5 años.
La actividad que ella realiza es la elaboración y venta de refrescos de frutas amazónicas como cocona, camu camu, cebada y otros. Para eso cuenta con puesto ambulatorio en un centro comercial muy concurrido de la ciudad. Se inició con un préstamo privado más un capital propio hace más de 3 años, pero por falta de capital no pudo industrializar sus productos, realizándolos de manera casera, cuenta con el apoyo de dos personas que venden sus refrescos en otros puntos de la ciudad. Le gusta su negocio, pues le permite tener un oficio, además de los ingresos económicos que le genera para apoyar a su pareja para pagar los gastos de su hogar. Su mayor problema es cuando llueve muy seguido, eso dificulta la venta de su producto, pues depende mucho del clima para incrementar sus ventas, pero eso no la desanima. 

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP. Se siente muy cómoda con el banco comunal al que acaba de ingresar, pues los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 800 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de frutas amazónicas en mayor volumen para variar el sabor de sus refrescos.
texts.en:
Raquel, 20, is a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead. Her partner Alexander is a passenger driver and the father of her only daughter, 5-year-old Ofelia. Raquel sells drinks made from Amazonian fruits and plants such as cocona, camu camu, cebada, and others from a vendor cart located in a busy city mall. She started her business with a loan and private capital three years ago, but insufficient capital prevented her from mass producing her products, which she makes at home. Two other vendors help her by selling her drinks in other parts of the city. 

She likes her business because it gives her a profession that generates income and helps her partner meet the household expenses. Her biggest problem is periods of constant rain, which impedes sales of her products; increasing sales depends a lot on weather, but that doesn't discourage her. 

This is her first loan with MFP. She is comfortable with the communal bank she just joined because she feels the members are responsible and caring. The  loan of 800 nuevos soles will be used to buy wholesale Amazonian fruits to add more drink flavors.

loans.use: to buy the fruits to make her drinks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Alexandra tiene 21 años, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre, además de tener mucho entusiasmo y ganas de salir adelante. Es soltera y todavía no tiene hijos.  Vive en casa de sus padres, con ellos y sus dos hermanas.
Su negocio es la venta de gaseosas. Para eso cuenta con una congeladora donde guarda sus bebidas a baja temperatura, como les agrada a sus clientes por el clima caluroso de la zona. Se inició hace 2 años con un capital propio y además quería darle un uso a su congeladora. Cuando ella no está en casa su madre la ayuda con la atención de los clientes. Le gusta su actividad al contar con un ingreso económico para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, ya que el sueldo de su padre no les alcanzaba. Ha logrando aumentar su capital y reinvirtiendo en su negocio, viéndolo crecer poco a poco, pues tiene planes de tener una fuente de soda.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los préstamos anteriores. Además se siente cómoda con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más gaseosas de diversas marcas y presentaciones, en mayor volumen, por cajas para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Alexandra is 21, hard-working and pleasant, and shows great enthusiasm for attaining success. She is single and without children, and lives in her parents' home with them and her two sisters.
Her business is selling soft drinks.  For this activity, she has a freezer to store the drinks at cool temperatures, to give her clients relief from the hot climate.  Two years ago she began with her own money using the freezer.  When she is not home, her mother assists with serving customers.  She enjoys her business and helping her parents with household expenses, as her father's income was not sufficient.  She has now increased her working capital and is seeing her business grow little by little, and she has plans to open an eatery.

This is her third credit from MFP, and she is committed to prompt repayment, as she has with prior loans.  She feels comfortable as a member of her communal lender, and considers her colleagues responsible and supportive.
With this credit of 1000 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying new varieties and brands of soft drinks, in greater volumes of boxes to maximize profits.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of soft drinks to sustain sales

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
This is Celia. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Celia hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been in farming for the last ten years, and his personal goal is to build a permanent home and educate his children up to a university level. He faces hardships of seasonal weather and the high-cost of production; nevertheless, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops and venturing into mechanized agriculture. John needs a loan to buy tea seedlings for planting.

loans.use: To buy tea seedlings for planting

loans.name: Odalis

texts.es:
Odalis tiene 32 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy responsable. Su pareja es Richard, de 40 años, con quien tiene dos hijos; Yeni de 13 y Richard de 7 años.
Su trabajo consiste en la compra y venta de motocarros. Su negocio está ubicado en su vivienda, en una esquina muy concurrida de su zona, allí espera la llegada de sus clientes o sale a buscarlos como es muy común en ella, ya que no le gusta estar sin realizar ninguna actividad. Al momento de realizar la transacción de los vehículos siempre está muy al pendiente de brindar todos los documentos en regla y que estén en óptimas condiciones. Lleva realizando este negocio cerca de 5 años y lo hace a lado de su pareja, quien se encarga de refaccionar los vehículos que ponen luego a la venta. Le gusta lo que hace, ya que le permite tener buenos ingresos, a veces saca un porcentaje alto de las ventas, pero algunas veces solo gana para sobrellevar los gastos del día, pero siempre está con buen ánimo.

Este es su crédito numero 6 con la institución MFP, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos y crecimiento. Además está muy decidida a cumplir, una vez más, con sus pagos de manera puntual, como lo hizo hasta ahora. Le agrada mucho pertenecer al grupo que integra, ya que reconoce que todos los miembros son personas muy puntuales y responsables.

Con el monto solicitado, 3000 nuevos soles, comprará más motocarros para continuar con su negocio y tener mayor variedad de marcas y modelos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Odalis, 32, is an enterprising and responsible woman.  Her partner is Richard, 40, and together they have two children: Yeni, 13, and Richard, 7.

Odalis has a business buying and selling moto-cars (light, 3-wheeled passenger vehicles).  She carries out her business in her house, which is located in a very busy corner of her neighborhood.  Here she awaits the arrival of customers, or she goes out to find them, something she commonly does because she doesn't like to be without anything to do.  When she is selling the vehicles, she is always aware of providing all of the documents required by law, and that the vehicles are in optimal condition.  She has been doing this work for nearly 5 years, and she works alongside her husband.  He is in charge of reconditioning the vehicles that they put up for sale.  Odalis enjoys her work, because it allows her to have a good income.  At times she takes a high percentage of the sales, but sometimes she earns only enough to cover the daily expenses, but she is always in good spirits.

This is her 6th loan with the MFP institution, and she appreciates all of the people who are making this loan possible so that she can continue with her goals and objectives.  Also, she is very committed to once again making her payments in a punctual manner, as she has always done up until now.  She really appreciates belonging to her communal bank, because she acknowledges that all of the members are responsible people who are punctual with their payments.

With the sum of 3,000 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will buy more moto-cars to continue with her business so that she can have a greater variety of brands and models to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy moto-cars to recondition and put up for sale

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley tiene 20 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y decidida. Su pareja es Jonathan, quien se dedica al transporte y es el padre de su único hijo. Por el momento viven en la casa de sus suegros.
Ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos sabores regionales. Para eso cuenta con un puesto de venta en un centro comercial muy concurrido de la ciudad. Se inició con un capital propio hace más de 5 años y hasta ahora atiende sola a sus clientes. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, pues tiene una constante clientela, siendo sus refrescos muy demandados por lo caluroso de la región. Sus planes a futuro son de incursionar en la venta de ropa, pero sin dejar su actual negocio.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete que será responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, como en el crédito anterior. Además de estar contenta con su banco comunal, pues aprende nuevas cosas con los talleres que brinda su asesor de créditos.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes para la preparación de sus refrescos, como frutas regionales y maíz morado, para la tradicional “chicha morada”.
texts.en:
Shirley is a dedicated and hard-working 20 year old, her partner is named Jonathan whom is the father of her only child; he works in transportation.  For the time being, they live with their in-laws.  She makes soft drinks with regional flavors and sells them at a busy market in the city.  She started the business with her own capital 5  years ago and to this day she tends to her clients alone.  She considers the business very viable due to its earnings, steady clientele, and because of the high demand for her soft drinks in this hot region.  Her future plans are to venture into clothing sales but without leaving her current business.

This is her 2nd loan with MFP, and meanwhile she hopes to be able to fulfill her objectives.  She promises to be responsible with the payments of this loan just as she was with her previous loan.  Aside from being happy with her communal bank, she also learns alot from the workshops offered by her credit assesors.   With the loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she will invest it towards the purchase of ingredients needed to prepare the soft drinks such as:  regional fruits, and purple corn for the traditional "chicha morada".

loans.use: to purchase fruits and purple corn for the preperation of her soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more supplies, snacks and soft drinks for his store

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a thirty one year old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been a farmer for the last five years and the business has been profitable despite hardships of price fluctuation and inflation. He has a personal goal of building a permanent home while his business plan is buying land to grow more crops. Moses intends to use the loan to prune and mulch his plantations.

loans.use: to prune and mulch his plantations.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
This is Maxima. She previously obtained a 20,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy fertilizer, pots, seedlings, wires, and plastics needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for maintenance of the farm. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Maxima dreams that her business will grow and expand. She also wants to help her family financially.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to buy gardening items needed in her business

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a civil servant and has been in service for over five years. He has a personal goal of educating his children up to the University and building a permanent house for residence. Solomon intends to use the loan to buy building materials for construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for construction of his house.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 40 años, es un hombre de trabajo, muy empeñoso con ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Aleida, la madre de sus dos hijos. Juntos viven en la casa que compró con mucho esfuerzo con el apoyo de su pareja.

Él es entrenador de fútbol de menores, para lo cual cuenta con una academia que funciona en su misma vivienda, pero para realizar los entrenamientos alquila lozas deportivas de la municipalidad de su ciudad. También realiza la venta de implementos deportivos como pelotas, camisetas y otros. Empezó como delegado en otra academia, aprendiendo y viendo la oportunidad de negocio, decidió a independizarse hace más de 2 años, habiendo realizado estudios para entrenador de menores y contando con todos las acreditaciones necesarias. Considera rentable su negocio por la cantidad de menores inscritos a su academia y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta  su actividad, pues cuenta con un ingreso económico para pagar los gastos de educación de sus hijos y apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logrará sacar adelante a su familia que son su motivación. Su meta a futuro es tener una tienda de venta de implementos deportivos.

Este es su préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP y se siente emocionado con el apoyo que recibe para avanzar con su negocio. Desea seguir contando con este apoyo, por eso se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, así tendrá acceso a más créditos. Además se siente contento de estar en su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la comprar de implementos deportivos como camisetas, medias, chimpunes, pelotas y otros, buscando precios bajos por el volumen de su compra.
texts.en:
Luis is 40 years old and is a hard-working man with a desire to get ahead.  His partner is Aleida, the mother of his two children.  The live together in the house that he bought with a lot of effort and with the support of his partner.

He is a youth soccer coach, for which he has an academy that he runs in his own home.  But, to carry out the trainings he rents soccer fields from his city's municipality.  He also sells sports equipment like balls, t-shirts and other things.  He began as a delegate in another academy, learning and seeing the business opportunity.  He decided to become independent over 2 years ago, having completed youth coaching classes and all of the necessary accreditations. He considers his business profitable because of the quantity of youth enrolled in his academy and the good earnings this brings.  He likes his business since he has an economic income to pay for the educational expenses of his children and support his partner in the household expenses.  He knows that with a lot of effort and dedication he will be able to get his family ahead with his motivation.  His future goal is to have an athletic equipment store.

This is his 10th loan with the institution MFP and he is excited about the support he receives to advance with his business. He wants to continue counting on this support.  Because of this he promises to be punctual with the payment of his dues, so he will have access to more loans.  Furthermore, he is content to be in his communal bank since he considers the members responsible and supportive people.

With the amount requested, 2000 nuevo soles, he will invest in buying sports equipment like t-shirts, long socks, cleats, balls and other things, looking for low prices because of the volume of his order.

loans.use: to buy sports equipment (t-shirts, sneakers, balls, etc.) for his soccer academy

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 41 años, es un hombre trabajador, emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Nila, quien es comerciante, no tienen hijos. Ellos viven en la casa de sus suegros.
Él se dedica a la venta de ropa y joyas. Su mercadería la compra en la capital y la vende desde su casa a sus amistades, vecinos y familiares. Lleva realizando este negocio hace más de 8 años gracias a la idea de su pareja, contando su apoyo, en sus ratos libres, para la búsqueda de nuevos clientes y la cobranza de los créditos entregados. Le gusta su negocio, pues le permite contar con un ingreso económico, además de tener un oficio independiente. Antes de iniciar con esta actividad tenía varios problemas por la falta de empleo, pero ahora está viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo y planea incrementar el volumen de sus ventas, diversificando los artículos que ofrece.

Este es su préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Además, se siente a gusto con el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues siente el apoyo mutuo y la solidaridad de sus integrantes.
Con el monto solicitado, 3500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más ropa y royas de toda variedad y calidad, a precio por mayor. También solventará los gastos de su viaje a la capital.
texts.en:
Víctor is 41 hard-working and eager to grow his business.  His wife is Nila, a saleswoman, and they have no children.  They live in their relative's home.
He sells clothing and jewelry for a living.  He buys his merchandise in the capital and sells them out of his home to his friends, neighbors and relatives. He has run this business for 8 years with the help of his wife; and in his spare time, he looks for new customers and collects payments for delivered goods.  He enjoys his business as it allows him to cover his expenses and also to work independently.  Before this, he had many troubles finding work, but now sees good results and plans to increase the volume of sales by diversifying the items offered. 

This is his fourth credit from MFP, and he hopes it will continue to allow him to meet his goals. He also feels great support from the communal lender and its members.  With this credit of 3500 nuevos soles, he will buy wholesale clothing and a greater variety of jewelry for resale. This credit will also cover his travel expenses to the capital.

loans.use: to travel to the capital to buy more merchandise (clothing and jewelry)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn tiene 22 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa, además de amable y solidaria. Está separada del padre de su hija. Actualmente vive con ella en la casa de sus padres, con ellos y su hermano.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de toda variedad, pues compra las prendas que elabora su madre y las vende. Viene realizando esta actividad hace más de un año y la considera rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, además que puede contar con tiempo libre para dedicarlo a su hija y de sentirse una mujer ocupada y productiva. Ahora está muy entusiasmada y espera poder crecer en su negocio y formar un taller de confecciones en sociedad con su madre.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con la institución MFP, por lo que espera poder concretar sus planes. Se siente bien con su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría de sus miembros que son sus vecinos y los considera personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más ropa interior de diversos modelos y tallas para continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 22, is a hardworking, diligent woman who is also friendly and caring. She is separated from her daughter's father and now lives with her daughter, brother, and parents in her parents' home. For more than a year, she has been selling a variety of underwear that she buys from her mother, who sews the items. The business is profitable and allows her free time to be with her daughter while making her feel she is busy and productive. She is very optimistic and hopes to be able to grow her business and open a dressmaking shop in partnership with her mother.

This is her third loan cycle with MFP, and she hopes to firm up her plans. She gets along well with her communal bank members because most of them are neighbors and she considers them responsible people. With the loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she will purchase a variety of underwear styles and brands to resell.

loans.use: to buy more underwear for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marjorie Lissette

texts.es: Marjorie es del Guasmo sector sur de Guayaquil, a sus 25 años le nació la idea de poner un pequeño negocio en su domicilio, esto es porque tenía que pagarse los estudios universitarios y a la vez estudiar. Con este pequeño negocio a podido ayudar a su familia, lo maneja sola ya que ella tipea los trabajos de computación, saca copias y da el servicio que soliciten, el negocio está ubicado a lado de la tienda de su mamá y atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche cuando no estudia. Su mayor problema es la delincuencia ya que donde vive es peligroso. Con el crédito que solicita va a comprar una copiadora porque de momento las copias la saca en su impresora y esto le aumenta los costos. A futuro espera poder abrir un cyber para mejorar sus servicios.
texts.en: Marjorie is from the Guasmo region south of Guayaquil. Due to her need to pay for her university education and keep up her studies, she decided to start a small business in her house when she was twenty-five years old. With this small business she has been able to help her family. She runs her business by herself since she types up documents on her computer, makes copies, and provides whatever services are requested of her. Her business is located next to her mother’s store, and she works from six in the morning until eleven at night when she is not studying. Since she lives in a dangerous area, her biggest problem is crime. She will use the loan she is requesting to purchase a copier because she is currently making copies with her printer, which increases her costs. In the future she hopes to be able to open a cyber cafe to increase the services she offers.

loans.use: to purchase a printer.

loans.name: Diana Caridad

texts.es:
La señora Diana de 30 años de edad, es madre soltera vive en casa de su madre, tiene una hija que depende de ella, se dedica desde hace unos 6 años al negocio que heredo de su madre, sus ventas son diarias de lunes a domingo en su negocio ella vende ropa nueva americana, zapatos para todas las edades, sus clientes son los maestros y amigos.
Diana solicita su préstamo para comprar achinería como, tintes, ganchos para el pelo, accesorios para damas y otros artículos de uso personal.
Con el apoyo del préstamo Diana lograra surtir un poco su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ingresos, y su deseo es seguir trabajando con PRISMA.
Diana su sueño es que se le mejoren las ventas y tener buenos clientes que le sean puntuales.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Diana is a 30 year old single mom who lives at her mom´s house and Diana´s child is still dependent on her.  She´s been selling clothing, a business left to her by her mother, for about 6 years now; she sells from Monday to Sunday.  She sells new American clothing and shoes for all ages and her clients range from friends to teachers.

Diana is soliciting her loan to purchase miscellaneous goods such as: dyes, hairpins, ladies' accesories and other personal use items.  With the help from the loan Diana will be able to stock her business and thus improve her sales.  Her wish is to continue working with PRISMA, improved sales, and have customers her are punctual.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, hairpins, female accesories, and other personal use items for her business.

loans.name: Pelzi

texts.en:
Pelzi is a married man with 4 children. He applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX to buy more items for his retail shop. Pelzi started his business 2 years ago after accumilating some savings. Previously, he worked in a motorcycle transportation business in which he paid 5,000 UGX per day to the owner. With the increasing needs of a family with 4 children in school, he decided to become independent so as to earn his own income. His daily income ranges between 5,000 UGX to 6,000 UGX on a good day.

Pelzi says that he has saved many people from traveling long distances to buy some products, like sugar and soap, among others. He is confident that once the shop is well-stocked, he will be able to meet the demands of his customers.

His major challenges are limited capital and traveling long distances to do his shopping. He plans to buy a motorcyle to ease his transportation needs. He also hopes to borrow more money from Ugafode Microfinance to supplement his capital needs.

loans.use: To buy day-to-day household items like soap, sugar, salt, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bring in more material to increase her productivity

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
This is Feliza. She previously obtained a 39,000 PHP loan that she utilized to purchase farm inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for maintenance of the farm. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Feliza dreams that her business will grow and expand. She also hopes her children will finish college.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Lety Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Lety tiene 34 años, vive en la zona sur de honduras, junto con ella vive su hijo y su esposo quien la ayuda en su actividad. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez de personas es en grandes cantidades, ya que esta a orilla de la calle principal y esto hace que sea muy visitado.
Lety el crédito lo necesita para la compra de: carnes, refrescos, lácteos, mariscos, arroz, lácteos, aceite, verduras etc. el impacto que espera con el financiamiento, es seguir dando una buena variedad de platillos para cada uno de sus clientes, como también un buen servicio, y de esta manera satisfacer la demanda de producto que le hacen sus clientes todos los días.
Los planes a futuro de Lety es que su negocio sea una de los mejores de su región, como también generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012.
texts.en:
Lety, 34, lives in southern Honduras with her child and husband, who works with her. Her business, strategically located on a major street, has a lot of customer traffic. Lety needs this loan to buy meats, sodas, milk products, seafood, rice, oil, vegetables, etc. She hopes the investment allows her to continue offering each customer a varied menu and great service and satisfy the daily demand for her products. Lety's future plans are to make her business one of the best in the area and to generate higher income for a better quality of life.

Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012.

loans.use: to buy meats, sodas, milk products, seafood, rice, oil, vegetables, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph used the previous loan to buy salt, rice, and sugar to sell. He is a 39-year-old married man living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has owned a retail shop for five years. His business challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, and customers not paying on time. Joseph's desires are to build a permanent house, to educate his children, and to expand his business into a big retail shop. Joseph intends to use the loan to purchase the same items, which include salt, rice, and sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy salt, rice, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a conservative woman, so she has asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Hanan is a mother of 4 children who lives in Irbid. She works together with her husband in making cotton candy and selling it in their neighborhood. She hopes to get a loan so she can buy a machine that makes cotton candy faster in addition to buying other products to sell so she can increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy a machine that makes cotton candy faster

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en:
Joselyne has been a loyal customer to this institution, and this is her fourth loan cycle. She has a poultry business and also works for one of the microfinance institutions in town. In her business, she faces challenges of price fluctuations and inflation. However, her dream is to educate her children up to a university level. 

Her business goal is to have at least 3,000 birds by the end of 2013. Joselyne intends to use the loan to purchase more chicks to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks to raise

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén tiene 52 años, es un hombre honesto, forjador de sus sueños y muy trabajador. Su pareja desde hace 20 años es Emma, con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 13, 5 y 4 años. Viven en la casa que construyó gracias al esfuerzo que pone en todos los trabajos que ha realizado con el único objetivo de brindarles a sus hijos las mejores condiciones de vida.

Su oficio es brindar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros. Tiene un motocarro que lo compró hace 4 años y desde entonces trabaja tratando de dar siempre lo mejor de sí para agradar a sus pasajeros y brindarles la confianza necesaria desde que inician su recorrido hasta que llegan a su destino. Por otro lado, comparte esta actividad brindando servicio de vigilancia nocturna como personal de seguridad en uno de los principales mercados de la ciudad. Lleva en esta ocupación 7 años y aunque reconoce que al principio no se logró acoplar a la rutina diaria, aprendió a manejar su tiempo con horarios de descanso y trabajo ya establecidos. Desde que se inició en sus actividades ha trabajado solo y siempre está atento a nuevas oportunidades, es por eso que ahora quiere instalar otro negocio en su casa, que es la venta de cervezas y gaseosas, ya que en su barrio nadie ha optado por esa labor. Espera hacerlo en corto tiempo y continuar esforzándose en todo lo que hace por el bien de su familia.

Este es su préstamo número 12 con la institución MFP. Siempre se caracterizó dentro de su grupo como una persona muy puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas y está seguro que esta vez no será la excepción. Está muy contento y agradecido por el apoyo que le están brindando para multiplicar su inversión y está muy comprometido con el grupo al que pertenece y espera seguir trabajando junto a ellos.

Con el monto solicitado, 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en el tapiz de su motocarro, el monto restante lo invertirá en la compra de cervezas y gaseosas para iniciar su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Ruben, 52, is an honest man who is very hardworking and is full of dreams.  His partner of 20 years is Emma, and together they have 4 children aged 17, 13, 5 and 4.  They live in the house that he built, thanks to all of the effort that he put into his work, with the sole aim of providing their children with better living conditions.  

Ruben has a business providing passenger transportation services.  He has a moto-car (light, 3-wheeled passenger vehicle) that he bought 4 years ago.  Ever since he has been working, trying to give the best of himself to please his customers and earn their trust from the moment they start their trip until they arrive at their destination.  In addition to this, he also works as a security guard at night in one of the main markets in the city.  He has been doing this work for 7 years, and although he acknowledges that at first he had trouble adapting to a daily routine, he learned to manage his time with hours of rest and a fixed work schedule.  Ever since the time he started doing these activities he has worked alone, and he is always on the lookout for new opportunities.  For this reason, he now wants to set up another business in his house selling beer and soft drinks, because in his neighborhood no one has chosen this type of business.  He hopes to do this very soon, and to continue to exert himself in everything he does for the good of his family.

This is his 12th loan with the MFP institution.  In his communal bank, he has always been known for being a very responsible person who is punctual with his payments, and he is sure that this time will be no exception.  He is very content and pleased with the support that he is being provided with to multiply his investment, and he is very committed to his communal bank and hopes to continue to work with them. 

With the sum of 1,000 Peruvian soles that he requests he will purchase a new awning for his moto-car, and with the sum that remains he will purchase beer and soft drinks to start his new business.

loans.use: to change the awning on his moto-car, and also to buy soft drinks and beer to start a new business

loans.name: Edison Gustavo

texts.es: Edison de 27 años vive con su familia en los Vergeles sector urbano que pertenece al norte de la ciudad. Edison es mecánico desde hace 10 años, aprendió esta actividad desde que era muy joven ya que le gustaba trabajar ganando su propio dinero, cuando se caso y adquirió responsabilidades decidió comenzar su taller. El negocio funciona en el patio de su casa realizándolo todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Tiene poco tiempo de independiente por lo que la falta de maquinarias  está perjudicando su atención eso es lo que desea mejorar y por lo que está solicitando el crédito. A futuro le gustaría poder comprar un automóvil para dar servicio de taxis y mejorar su economía.
texts.en: Edison is twenty-seven years old, and lives with his family in Los Vergeles, an urban region north of the city. Edison has been a mechanic for ten years. He learned his trade when he was very young since he liked to work and earn his own money. When he got married and took on responsibilities he decided to open his own repair shop. His business is located on the patio of his house, where he works every day from eight in the morning until six in the evening. He has very little free time and is wasting his effort because he lacks equipment. He would like to remedy this situation, which is why he is requesting a loan. In the future, he would like to be able to purchase an automobile to start a taxi service and improve his finances.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools.

loans.name: Alexandra Lucrecia

texts.es: Alexandra vive en el sector sur conocido como Isla Trinitaria, ella vive en una casa de su propiedad con todos los servicios básicos. Hace varios años empezó una tienda de abarrotes donde vendía arroz, azúcar y víveres pasando el tiempo y al ganar cliente aumento también sus productos, ahora en su tienda se encuentra de todo un poco. El negocio lo administra sola y ha sido su mejor decisión ya que así puede cuidar a sus hijos, se siente satisfecha con los logros que ha conseguido. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería y mantener surtida la tiende ya que así llama la atención de la clientela. Espera mejorar sus ventas para pagar puntualmente las letras y sobre todo mejorar su economía. Su sueño a futuro es ampliar el negocio ya que está un poco estrecho.
texts.en: Alexandra lives in the region known as Isla Trinitaria. She owns the house she lives in, which has all the basic services. Several years ago, she opened a grocery store where she sold rice, sugar, and basic supplies. As time passed and her customer base increased, she also increased the products she sold. Now, she has a little bit of everything available in her store. She runs her business by herself, and starting it has been the best decision she has made since now she can care for her children. She feels good about the achievements she has made. She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise and keep her store stocked, which is the best way to attract customers. She hopes to improve her sales so she can make her payments on time, and more importantly, improve her finances. Her dream for the future is to expand her store since it is a little cramped.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Nenita

texts.en:
This is Maria Nenita. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.
 
Maria Nenita hopes to be able to expand her business soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed for her business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina, 38, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a single parent and mother of two children. She, together with her children, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Regina operates an LPG business. What she basically does is buy Liquefied Petroleum Gas tanks from wholesalers and sell each tank for a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size tanks. She also sells cooked foods for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Regina is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Regina dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of LPG supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El señor Juan de 59 años de edad, es casado vive con su esposa en su casa ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras. Se dedica desde hace unos 30 años al negocio de venta de verduras en su carro el viaja de Tegucigalpa a San Lorenzo vendiendo sus verduras, su venta es ambulante y sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos que el tiene a lo largo de su recorrido como comerciante.
Don Juan esta solicitando 10,000.00 para compra de dos llantas para su carro, una batería y el resto para compra de verduras y frutas que son su negocio.
Don Juan con el apoyo de este préstamo seguirá trabajando y mejorando su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando y mejorando su negocio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2012.
texts.en:
Juan, 59, is married and lives with his wife in their house in the town of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. For almost 30 years, he has been selling fruits and vegetables. He travels by car selling his products from Tegucigalpa to San Lorenzo. His customers are the friends and neighbors he has met during his travels as a merchant.

Juan is requesting 10,000.00 to buy 2 tires, a battery, and fruits and vegetables for his business. The support from the loan will allow Juan to continue working and improving his circumstances and dream of expanding his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2012.

loans.use: to buy 2 tires, a battery, and fruits and vegetables for his business.

loans.name: Unidas Por Siempre Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú, en esta oportunidad conocerán mas sobre   La Alcancía Comunal“Unidas por Siempre” este es  un grupo conformada por  09  mujeres  se que dedican al comercio minorista, que por diferentes circunstancias tuvieron que buscar la manera de generar sus propios ingresos a través de sus negocios con el propósito de no faltar la economía en sus hogares, tal es el caso de Jane de 31 años es casada con 01 menor de edad. Ella empezó trabajando en una fábrica vendiendo muebles, con lo que pudo ahorrar con su trabajo para iniciar su proprio negocio, donde día a día ofrece sus productos  como pan con pollo, gelatinas, panchos etc. en las afueras de un colegio, este negocio le ha permitido apoyar en la educación de su hijo y también mejorar su vivienda.  Con el último crédito  comprara insumos para su negocio  como panes, gelatinas, papas, etc. y así poder preparar sus alimentos. Posteriormente piensa poner una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le generaría mayores ingresos.  El Grupo “Unidas Por Siempre”agradecen a los que hicieron posible este crédito.  Jane se encuentra en la parte posterior, es la primera del lado izquierdo viste una chompa color negro.
texts.en:
Greetings from Perú.  On this occasion you will learn more about the “Unidas por Siempre” (Together Forever) communal bank that has nine women who work in retail.  Because of a variety of circumstances, they had to find ways of earning their own income by means of their businesses so that their homes would not lack income.
 
Such is the case of Jane, 31.  She's married and has one minor child.  She started out working in a factory selling furniture which made it possible for her to save money in order to start a business of her own where every day she sells bread rolls, gelatin treats, snacks, etc. outside a school.  This business has allowed her to support her son’s schooling and also to make improvements to her dwelling.
 
With this current loan she will buy supplies for her business like bread rolls, gelatin treats, potatoes, etc. in order to prepare her dishes.  Later on, she plans to open a grocery store to generate higher income.  
 
The “Unidas por Siempre” group thanks those who made this loan possible.  Jane appears in the rear.  She’s first on the left and is wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy bread, gelatin, and potatoes.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is a father of six children and lives in Wehdat, which is in the east part of Amman. He is the owner of a small company that sells safety tools and products such as fire extinguishers and so on. Jihad hopes to get the loan so he can expand his market share and be able to work in cities other than Amman.

loans.use: to expand his market share.

loans.name: Jahaira Alexandra

texts.es: A Jahaira siempre le gusto el comercio por lo que empezó con una tienda pequeña con algunos víveres hace más de 5 años. Hoy en día tiene una tienda muy surtida en El Fortín lugar donde ella vive, cuando inicio el negocio no había muchas tiendas por lo que mantiene una clientela bastante extensa tanto por su tiempo como por la atención, como su esposo es agricultor sus productos son frescos. El negocio lo maneja con sus hijos desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche cuando cierra su local. Sus productos son de primera necesidad por lo que más vende es arroz, azúcar, enlatados, verduras, artículos de limpieza etc., el préstamo para el que está aplicando es para aumentar los productos que vende ya que algunos le falta. Espera a futuro que su negocio tenga mejores rendimientos ya que quiere hacer más amplio su negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jahaira has always loved business, and, therefore, opened a small shop with a few groceries over 5 years ago. Today, her well-stocked store is located in her neighborhood El Fortín. There were few stores when she opened, which allowed her to maintain a wide clientele on the basis of her hours and service. Since her husband is a farmer, her products are always fresh.

She manages her business with her children from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m., when she closes the store. Her merchandise comprises basic commodities, so she sells mostly rice, sugar, canned goods, vegetables, cleaning supplies, and so on. She is requesting this loan to expand her stock to include other items. She hopes her business will be more profitable and also wants to help her husband prosper by expanding it.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, canned goods, vegetables, and cleaning supplies.
